2. Keep the top leg straight and foot flexed.
3. Lift the top leg upward while keeping hips stacked and core engaged.
4. Lower the leg with control back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and lift from the side of the hip without rotating the torso

Health benefit: Improves shoulder and thoracic mobility while encouraging upright trunk posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and hands resting at your sides.
2. Inhale and reach both arms overhead, extending through the fingertips.
3. Exhale and lower the arms back down with control.
Safety cue: Sit tall and reach without arching the lower back while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and improves contralateral coordination and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine and shoulders over wrists.
2. Extend one arm forward and the opposite leg straight back at the same time.
3. Hold the extended position while keeping hips square and core engaged.
4. Return both hand and knee to the starting position and switch sides.
Safety cue: Extend opposite arm and leg while keeping hips level and core stable

Health benefit: Strengthens lower body muscles and enhances sit to stand functional ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and a chair behind you.
2. Lower hips back and lightly touch the chair with control.
3. Press through the heels to stand fully upright.
4. Reset your stance and repeat the movement.
Safety cue: Sit back into the chair keeping knees behind toes and chest lifted

Health benefit: Increases quadriceps flexibility and supports comfortable knee range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees stacked and legs bent.
2. Reach back and grasp your top ankle and pull the heel toward your glute.
3. Hold the position, then release and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and pelvis neutral while gently pulling the foot toward the glute

Health benefit: Enhances upper back strength and promotes better shoulder blade control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with knees bent and feet planted.
2. Hold the band or handle with arms extended and palms facing.
3. Pull elbows back while squeezing the shoulder blades.
4. Extend the arms slowly to the starting position.
Safety cue: Retract shoulder blades and keep a tall spine while pulling through the elbows

Health benefit: Improves upper body endurance and hand eye coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and knees soft.
2. Keep feet planted and hands up to guard your chin.
3. Throw slow, controlled jabs and crosses using torso rotation.
4. Return your hands to the guard after each combination.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves scapular mobility and supports upright posture awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with back and head against the wall and feet a few inches away.
2. Bend elbows to 90 degrees and press arms into the wall.
3. Slide arms up the wall while maintaining contact and posture.
4. Slide arms down with control to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep lower back against the wall and move arms slowly with scapular control

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors to enhance lateral hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with hips stacked and knees bent to 90 degrees.
2. Keep feet together and lift the top knee toward the ceiling.
3. Lower the knee with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and control the movement from the glutes without rotating the pelvis

Health benefit: Increases lateral trunk flexibility and engages core side muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall at the edge of a chair with feet flat on the floor.
2. Place one hand on the thigh and reach the other arm overhead.
3. Bend laterally toward the grounded hand, then return upright and switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Activates outer hip muscles and contributes to balance during single side stance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with one hand lightly on a support and feet hip-width.
2. Keep the torso straight and lift the outside leg out to the side to hip level.
3. Lower the leg with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Hold support lightly, keep torso upright, and lift from the outer hip without leaning

Health benefit: Builds posterior shoulder endurance and improves upper back alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead in a Y and thumbs up.
2. Keep the neck neutral and lift the arms off the ground using the upper back.
3. Pause at the top while squeezing the shoulder blades.
4. Lower the arms slowly back to the mat.
Safety cue: Keep neck long, lift the arms with scapular engagement, and avoid arching the lower back

Health benefit: Enhances abdominal endurance and promotes coordinated trunk rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands behind your head and knees bent.
2. Lift head and shoulders and extend one leg while bringing the opposite elbow toward the flexed knee.
3. Rotate the torso and switch sides in a slow, controlled motion.
4. Continue alternating with deliberate, steady movements.
Safety cue: Keep lower back pressed to the mat, move slowly, and breathe steadily through each twist

Health benefit: Improves hip external rotation and gluteal flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat and knees at 90 degrees.
2. Cross the right ankle over the left knee and keep the spine long.
3. Lean forward from the hips until you feel a stretch in the outer hip.
4. Hold the position and then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep spine tall and hinge at the hips to avoid rounding

Health benefit: Opens the chest and enhances shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place forearms on each side of the frame at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward and keep the torso upright.
3. Gently lean forward until you feel a stretch across the chest.
4. Hold the stretch and then step back to release.
Safety cue: Anchor shoulder blades down and gently open the chest without shrugging

Health benefit: Raises heart rate gently while increasing shoulder and arm mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and arms at your sides.
2. Raise both arms out to the sides and overhead until palms meet.
3. Lower the arms back to your sides with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Control arm movement and keep shoulders relaxed away from ears

Health benefit: Gently lengthens the lower back and increases hip flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with legs extended and arms by your sides.
2. Bend the right knee and draw it toward your chest using both hands behind the thigh.
3. Keep the left leg relaxed on the floor and hold the stretch.
4. Lower the right leg and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds lateral core strength and improves trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and forearm on the floor under your shoulder.
2. Press into the forearm and lift your hips to form a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Keep the top hand on your hip or reach it toward the ceiling.
4. Hold the position and then lower with control.
Safety cue: Stack hips over knees and shoulders and press through the supporting knee for alignment

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and leg movement coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on the edge of a chair or mat with feet flat on the floor.
2. Slide one heel forward along the floor until the leg is nearly straight.
3. Pull the heel back to the start and repeat with the other leg.
Safety cue: Engage your core and slide the leg slowly without letting the pelvis tilt

Health benefit: Increases shoulder range of motion and upper body circulation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit tall with arms extended straight out to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Make small controlled circles forward with both arms.
3. Continue for the desired time or repetitions.
4. Reverse the direction and circle backward with the same control.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and perform controlled small circles without flaring the ribs

Health benefit: Encourages spinal flexion and promotes relaxation of the back muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on the mat with big toes touching and knees hip-width apart.
2. Sit back toward your heels and lower your torso over your thighs.
3. Extend your arms forward and rest your forehead on the mat.
4. Relax into the position and hold.
Safety cue: Reach hips back toward heels and breathe deeply while keeping the spine long

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain muscles and enhances back extensor endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Lift your chest, arms, and legs a few inches off the floor while keeping neck neutral.
3. Hold the lift briefly and then lower back down with control.
Safety cue: Lift chest and legs slightly while keeping the neck neutral and core engaged

Health benefit: Improves ankle mobility and proprioceptive awareness through controlled movements
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall and lift one foot a few inches off the floor while keeping the leg still.
2. Use your big toe to trace the letters of the alphabet slowly in the air.
3. Lower the foot and repeat the alphabet with the other ankle.
Safety cue: Stabilize the thigh and trace the alphabet with the ankle using slow steady breaths

Health benefit: Enhances rotational core strength and trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Lean back slightly and clasp your hands in front of your chest.
3. Rotate your torso to touch the floor beside one hip.
4. Rotate to the opposite side and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and rotate through the upper torso, not by swinging the arms

Health benefit: Improves inner thigh flexibility and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall and press the soles of your feet together.
2. Hold your feet and draw your heels toward your groin.
3. Hinge forward from the hips and lower your chest toward your feet.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds triceps and shoulder strength for upper body pushing movements
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a chair or the floor with hands beside your hips and fingers forward.
2. Slide your hips off the edge and extend your legs as desired.
3. Bend your elbows to lower your hips toward the floor.
4. Push through your palms to straighten your arms and lift your hips.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and back, lowering with controlled range of motion

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and scapular coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with arms extended straight in front at chest height.
2. Cross one arm over the other in a controlled motion.
3. Open the arms back out and alternate which arm crosses on each rep.
Safety cue: Sit tall, draw shoulder blades down and move the arms with control

Health benefit: Activates glutes and enhances hip extension strength and pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Brace your core and bend one knee to 90 degrees.
3. Drive your heel up toward the ceiling by extending the hip.
4. Lower the knee back toward the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves trunk rotational mobility and control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips or across your chest.
2. Rotate your torso to one side while keeping your hips facing forward.
3. Rotate back through center and repeat to the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep hips facing forward, soften the knees and rotate from the thoracic spine

Health benefit: Combines upper body strength work with thoracic mobility and core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Begin in a high plank with hands beneath your shoulders.
2. Bend your elbows and lower your chest toward the floor into a push-up.
3. Press back through your hands and lift your hips to sit back into child pose.
4. Return hands to the floor and come back into plank to repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and move with control, breathing as you transition into child pose

Health benefit: Strengthens hip flexors and improves lower abdominal control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one leg straight and the other bent with foot flat.
2. Keep the straight leg active and point the toes upward.
3. Lift the straight leg to about hip level with control.
4. Lower the leg slowly back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances spinal mobility and promotes posture awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with hands on your knees and feet flat on the floor.
2. Inhale and arch your spine, lift your chest, and look slightly upward.
3. Exhale and round your spine, tuck your chin, and draw your belly in.
Safety cue: Articulate the spine slowly and coordinate each flexion and extension with your breath

Health benefit: Increases thoracic rotation mobility and improves upper back movement
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Place one hand behind your head and keep the elbow wide.
3. Rotate your chest toward the ceiling, opening the thoracic spine.
4. Return the elbow toward the floor and switch sides after the set.
Safety cue: Keep hips stable and rotate through the thoracic spine while keeping the neck aligned

Health benefit: Enhances core and shoulder endurance while promoting coordinated lower body movement
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands shoulder-width on an elevated surface and step back into a straight plank.
2. Slowly draw one knee toward your chest while keeping hips level.
3. Return that foot to the starting plank and draw the opposite knee forward.
4. Move deliberately and keep the spine neutral throughout.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and hips level while driving knees slowly toward chest
is_not_suitable_for: Hypertension, Coronary Artery Disease, COPD, Metabolic Syndrome, Hyperthyroidism

Health benefit: Increases thoracic mobility and chest flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and wrap both arms around your torso as if hugging yourself.
2. Pull your shoulders forward and hold the gentle stretch across the chest.
3. Release and repeat as needed.
Safety cue: Relax shoulders down away from the ears and breathe deeply into the ribcage

Health benefit: Improves single leg stability and balance with minimal joint stress
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one hand lightly on a stable support and step one foot back into a shallow lunge.
2. Bend both knees slightly so the front knee stays over the ankle.
3. Keep your torso upright and hips square to the front.
4. Hold the position and then switch legs if desired.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal muscles and hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands by your sides and knees bent over hips.
2. Exhale and curl your hips upward, lifting your tailbone off the floor.
3. Pause at the top while keeping abs engaged.
4. Lower your hips and return to the start with control.
Safety cue: Use slow controlled movement and tuck the pelvis to lift with the lower abs

Health benefit: Enhances standing balance and proprioception using external support
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a wall and place one hand lightly on it for balance.
2. Place one foot directly in front of the other so the heel touches the toe of the back foot.
3. Hold the straight posture and shift weight slowly onto the front foot.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds upper body strength and improves scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place hands shoulder-width on the wall at chest height.
2. Step back so your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Bend your elbows to bring your chest toward the wall.
4. Push back to the starting position with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Boosts upper body endurance and improves coordination and rhythm
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and hands at chin level.
2. Punch one arm forward in a controlled motion while retracting the other hand.
3. Alternate punches at a steady tempo.
4. Keep a light tension in the core and maintain an upright posture.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a braced core and rotate from the torso when punching

Health benefit: Increases ankle dorsiflexion range and supports functional movement patterns
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place your foot a few inches from the base with heel on the floor.
2. Keep the heel down and bend your knee forward toward the wall.
3. Touch the knee to the wall or move as far as mobility allows without lifting the heel.
4. Return the knee to the start and repeat for the other side.
Safety cue: Drive the knee toward the wall while keeping the heel down and the foot planted

Health benefit: Activates glute muscles and promotes hip extension strength and pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat hip-width apart.
2. Press through your heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Squeeze your glutes at the top and avoid overextending the lower back.
4. Lower your hips slowly back to the ground.
Safety cue: Press through the heels, lift by squeezing the glutes, and avoid overextending the lower back

Health benefit: Increases posterior thigh flexibility and improves range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with one leg extended and the other bent inward.
2. Flex the foot of the extended leg and keep the spine long.
3. Hinge at the hips and reach toward the toes without rounding the back.
4. Hold for 20–30 seconds while breathing evenly.
Safety cue: Keep spine long and hinge from the hips rather than rounding the back

Health benefit: Boosts coordination and elevates heart rate with low joint impact
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and hands at your sides.
2. Step one foot out to the side while lifting both arms overhead.
3. Return the foot and arms to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Step with control and keep knees soft

Health benefit: Enhances balance and ankle stability through weight distribution practice
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a chair and place one hand lightly on the back for support.
2. Shift weight into the supporting leg and lift the other foot slightly off the floor.
3. Keep hips level and engage the core to maintain balance.
4. Hold for the target time, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Stand tall with hips level and lightly hold support for balance

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and promotes better spinal rotation patterns
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and arms extended forward, palms together.
2. Keep hips stacked and lift the top arm, rotating the chest upward toward the ceiling.
3. Follow the moving hand with your eyes and rotate until you feel a gentle turn.
4. Lower the arm back to the start and repeat for the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and rotate through the upper back without shrugging the shoulder

Health benefit: Strengthens core muscles and supports improved posture and trunk control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands or forearms and knees with body in a straight line from head to knees.
2. Engage the core and press hips level without sagging or lifting.
3. Hold the position while breathing steadily for the desired duration.
Safety cue: Brace the core and maintain a straight line from knees to head

Health benefit: Activates glute muscles and enhances hip extension strength for daily activities
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall facing a support and place one or both hands lightly on it for balance.
2. Keeping the knee straight, lift one leg backward by squeezing the glute.
3. Lower the leg with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis neutral and squeeze the glute to lift without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Increases chest flexibility and reduces shoulder rounding from prolonged sitting
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place one forearm on the frame at shoulder height.
2. Step forward with the foot on the same side and lean your chest through the doorway.
3. Keep the shoulder down and hold the stretch, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and press the chest forward gently without shrugging

Health benefit: Raises heart rate moderately while improving hip flexor control and gait pattern
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and march by lifting one knee toward hip height while keeping the opposite foot on the floor.
2. Pump the opposite arm as the knee rises and maintain an upright posture.
3. Lower the foot with control and continue alternating at a steady slow pace.
Safety cue: Stand tall, lift knees with control and keep a steady breath

Health benefit: Strengthens inner thigh muscles and promotes pelvic stability during seated positions
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with a small pillow or ball between your knees.
2. Press your knees together to squeeze the pillow using inner thigh muscles.
3. Hold the squeeze briefly, then release with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Sit tall, brace the core and squeeze with the inner thighs

Health benefit: Enhances coordinated core stability and improves controlled limb movement patterns
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent at 90 degrees and arms extended toward the ceiling.
2. Engage the core and press the lower back into the floor.
3. Slowly lower one arm overhead while extending the opposite leg toward the floor.
4. Return to the start and repeat on the other side with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves spinal mobility and promotes gentle movement through the back and neck
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands under shoulders and knees under hips in a neutral spine.
2. Inhale and drop the belly while lifting the head and tailbone to arch the back.
3. Exhale and round the spine while tucking the chin and tailbone to perform the cat.
4. Continue alternating slowly with each breath.
Safety cue: Flow slowly between cat and cow keeping core engaged and neck aligned

Health benefit: Enhances balance and walking coordination with assisted support
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and place one foot directly in front of the other with toes touching heel.
2. Hold a stable support with one hand for balance and take a controlled step forward onto the heel.
3. Transfer weight to the toes and repeat each step while keeping posture upright.
Safety cue: Walk slowly placing heel to toe with hips level and eyes forward

Health benefit: Builds upper body strength and improves pushing ability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a sturdy chair and place hands beside hips with fingers pointing forward.
2. Slide hips off the chair and lower the body by bending elbows to about 90 degrees.
3. Push through palms to straighten arms and lift hips back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Lower until elbows are about 90 degrees keeping shoulders down and chest open

Health benefit: Boosts shoulder mobility and increases circulation to the arms
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with arms extended to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Rotate both arms quickly in small circles forward for the desired count.
3. Reverse the direction and continue fast circles while keeping the core engaged.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and spine tall while controlling the arm circles

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and enhances pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent, heels together, and head supported by your arm.
2. Keeping feet touching, lift the top knee up while keeping hips stacked.
3. Lower the knee back down with control and repeat for reps then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and pelvis stable while opening the top knee with control

Health benefit: Promotes gentle spinal lengthening and relaxation of the back and hips
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on the floor and sit back on the heels with big toes touching.
2. Reach the arms forward and lower the torso until the forehead rests on the mat.
3. Relax the shoulders and breathe while holding the position.
Safety cue: Breathe deeply and reach hips back toward heels while keeping the spine long

Health benefit: Activates core muscles while enhancing shoulder stability and body control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees and lift knees a few inches off the ground while keeping hips level.
2. Align hands under shoulders and gaze slightly forward.
3. Hold the body in a straight line from head to knees while engaging the core.
4. Breathe steadily and maintain the hover for the set time.
Safety cue: Maintain a flat back and braced core avoiding sagging or piking hips

Health benefit: Strengthens calf muscles and improves ankle stability for better balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and hands lightly touching a support.
2. Push through the balls of both feet to raise the heels as high as possible.
3. Lower the heels back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Rise through the balls of the feet with controlled movement and a tall posture

Health benefit: Improves neck flexibility and reduces muscular tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed and chin parallel to the floor.
2. Tilt the head slowly toward one shoulder until a gentle stretch is felt.
3. Return to center and repeat toward the other shoulder with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Move the neck slowly within a pain-free range while keeping shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Targets outer hip muscles and enhances lateral leg strength
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with the lower arm supporting the head and legs stacked straight.
2. Lift the top leg upward while keeping it straight and the hips stacked.
3. Lower the leg with control back to the starting position and repeat then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core engaged while lifting the top leg with control

Health benefit: Enhances single-leg balance and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall next to a chair and place one hand on the back for support.
2. Shift weight onto one foot and lift the other foot slightly off the ground.
3. Hold the raised position while keeping hips level and core engaged.
4. Lower the lifted foot back down with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and core engaged while maintaining a steady gaze

Health benefit: Builds core endurance and elevates cardiovascular effort
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands shoulder-width on a stable elevated surface and step back into a plank.
2. Draw one knee slowly toward the chest while keeping hips steady.
3. Extend the same leg back slowly and switch to the other knee in a controlled motion.
4. Continue alternating knees at a slow, steady pace.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders stacked over wrists and drive knees with controlled tempo

Health benefit: Promotes spinal extension and chest mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with hands near chest and elbows close to sides.
2. Press palms into the floor and slowly lift chest using the back muscles.
3. Keep shoulders down and hold the lifted position before lowering with control.
Safety cue: Keep pelvis grounded and lift chest using the midback while drawing shoulders down

Health benefit: Strengthens upper back and shoulder stabilizers
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead for the I position and forehead on the floor.
2. Lift both arms straight up into the I, squeezing shoulder blades, then lower with control.
3. Move arms into a Y shape and lift the arms, then lower with control.
4. Bring arms out to the sides in a T shape and lift, then lower with control.
Safety cue: Keep neck long and lift through the scapula with slow controlled movements

Health benefit: Develops quadriceps endurance and lower body stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with back against a wall and slide down until thighs are slightly above parallel.
2. Keep knees soft and weight through the heels while pressing back into the wall.
3. Hold the position for the desired time while maintaining steady breathing.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves hip flexor activation and circulation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and hands on the sides for support.
2. Lift one knee toward the chest while keeping the torso tall.
3. Lower the foot back to the floor and lift the opposite knee in a marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Sit tall with ribs down and march through controlled hip flexion without leaning back

Health benefit: Enhances lower back mobility and core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Flatten the lower back into the floor by tilting the pelvis upward and tightening the core.
3. Hold briefly and then return the pelvis to a neutral position with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases triceps flexibility and shoulder range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and reach one arm overhead bending the elbow to touch the upper back.
2. Use the opposite hand to gently pull the elbow toward the head.
3. Hold the stretch while keeping the chest open and then switch arms.
Safety cue: Keep spine long and shoulders relaxed while gently drawing the elbow toward the head

Health benefit: Builds knee-friendly leg strength and functional standing control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a stable support and hold it lightly with one or both hands.
2. Bend the knees slightly and sink into a shallow quarter squat keeping weight in the heels.
3. Keep the chest upright and core engaged during the descent.
4. Push through the heels to return to standing with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves core lateral stability and shoulder support capacity
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on one side with knees bent and prop the torso up on the forearm beneath the shoulder.
2. Stack hips and knees and lift the hips off the floor into a straight line from shoulder to knees.
3. Keep the top hand on the hip or extended for balance and hold the position.
4. Lower the hips with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves scapular mobility and shoulder blade control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back and hips against a wall and feet a few inches away.
2. Place your forearms and hands flat on the wall with elbows bent at 90°.
3. Slide your arms upward along the wall while keeping contact with the wall.
4. Lower your arms back to the start with control.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and draw shoulder blades together as you slide

Health benefit: Enhances spinal mobility and trunk rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair or mat with feet planted and hands behind your head or crossed over your chest.
2. Rotate your torso to one side using your core while keeping your hips facing forward.
3. Return to center with control and repeat to the other side.
Safety cue: Keep spine tall and rotate from the mid back

Health benefit: Promotes hip and knee mobility during lower limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with both legs straight and arms at your sides.
2. Bend one knee and slide your heel toward your glutes while keeping the foot on the surface.
3. Straighten the leg by sliding the heel away until fully extended and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves shoulder range of motion and proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit tall with one arm at shoulder height and elbow slightly bent.
2. Visualize a small clock face in front of your hand.
3. Reach your hand slowly to nearby "hours" within a small range.
4. Return to center with control between each reach.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and reach from the shoulder without shrugging

Health benefit: Increases inner thigh flexibility and gentle hip opening
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall and bring the soles of your feet together with knees dropped to the sides.
2. Hold your feet and gently pull them toward your groin.
3. Press your knees toward the floor with controlled pressure.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and hinge from the hips without rounding the lower back

Health benefit: Develops shoulder and upper chest strength with reduced shoulder loading compared to floor push-ups
Steps to perform:
1. Place your hands on a wall or elevated surface and walk your feet back until your hips form an inverted V.
2. Tighten your core and keep your gaze between your hands.
3. Bend your elbows and lower your head toward your hands with control.
4. Push through your hands to straighten your arms and return to the start.
Safety cue: Keep head in line with the spine and lower with controlled shoulder strength

Health benefit: Improves aerobic conditioning coordination and timing
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a shoulder-width stance with one foot slightly forward and hands in guard.
2. Throw controlled jabs, crosses, and hooks while keeping your guard up.
3. Rotate your hips slightly with each punch and maintain a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain a stable stance and breathe steadily while controlling your punches

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and promotes spinal extensor endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Lift your chest, arms, and legs a few inches off the ground while squeezing your back and glutes.
3. Hold the lifted position for the chosen time with steady breathing.
Safety cue: Keep ribs toward the floor and squeeze glutes and shoulder blades without overextending the neck

Health benefit: Increases hip internal rotation mobility and functional leg positioning
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with one knee bent at 90° and the foot flat on the floor.
2. Keep your thigh stable and rotate your lower leg and foot outward so the knee turns inward.
3. Return to neutral with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep the thigh level and rotate from the hip while keeping the pelvis steady

Health benefit: Encourages hamstring lengthening and gentle spinal elongation with relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width apart and knees softly bent.
2. Hinge at your hips and fold forward while maintaining a long spine.
3. Relax your neck and let your torso hang with gentle breathing.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances lower body strength and single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall facing forward and hold a chair or wall for support.
2. Step one foot back and lower your hips until both knees are bent at about 90 degrees.
3. Press through the front heel to straighten the front leg.
4. Return to standing and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Keep chest up, core braced, and front knee aligned over the ankle

Health benefit: Promotes hip mobility and spinal alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on hands and knees with shoulders over wrists and hips over knees.
2. Rock hips back toward your heels while keeping a neutral spine.
3. Rock forward until hips pass knees and return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and move slowly from the hips

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and improves lateral stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with hands on hips or holding a support.
2. Lift one leg straight out to the side keeping the toes facing forward and the knee straight.
3. Lower the leg slowly back to start and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep the standing hip stable and lift the leg with controlled motion

Health benefit: Develops core anti-rotation stability and torso control
Steps to perform:
1. Anchor a resistance band at chest height and stand sideways a few steps away.
2. Grasp the band with both hands at your chest and step to create tension.
3. Press your hands straight out from your chest and hold against the band's pull.
4. Slowly bring your hands back to your chest and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Brace your core and resist rotation as you press away from your body

Health benefit: Builds upper body strength and shoulder girdle control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place your hands on the wall at chest height shoulder-width apart.
2. Step your feet back to create a straight line from head to heels.
3. Bend your elbows to lower your chest toward the wall.
4. Push through your hands to straighten your arms and return to start.
Safety cue: Keep a straight line from head to heels and lower with control

Health benefit: Targets quadriceps strength and knee extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright in a chair with feet flat and hands resting on the sides.
2. Extend one leg forward until it is straight and your knee is unlocked.
3. Lower the leg back down with control and repeat with the other leg.
Safety cue: Sit tall, brace your core, and extend the knee with controlled motion

Health benefit: Improves cardiovascular fitness and upper body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and hands in light fists at chin level.
2. Extend one arm forward in a quick controlled punch while rotating your torso slightly.
3. Return the hand to the chin and punch with the other arm in an alternating rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain upright posture, engage the core, and control punches from the shoulders

Health benefit: Increases calf flexibility and ankle dorsiflexion range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands on it at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back keeping that leg straight and the heel pressed into the floor.
3. Lean into the wall until you feel a stretch in the back calf, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep the back heel down and spine long while leaning into the stretch

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and contralateral coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine and eyes down.
2. Extend your right arm forward and left leg back until they are in line with your torso.
3. Hold briefly while keeping hips level and core engaged.
4. Lower arm and leg back to start and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and spine neutral as you extend opposite arm and leg slowly

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and posterior chain for improved hip extension
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat hip-width apart.
2. Press through your heels to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Lower your hips back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Press through the heels, squeeze the glutes, and avoid overextending the lower back

Health benefit: Improves spinal rotational mobility and core activation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall near the edge of a chair with feet flat and hands on your thighs.
2. Twist your torso to the right while keeping hips facing forward.
3. Return to center and twist to the left with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Brace your core and rotate from the thoracic spine while keeping a tall posture

Health benefit: Increases hip rotational mobility and stretches lower back
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and arms out to the sides.
2. Lower both knees together toward the right side until they hover or touch the floor.
3. Return to center and lower the knees to the left side.
Safety cue: Keep both shoulders on the floor and control the crossover with your obliques

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal muscles and improves hip flexor control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a chair with hands gripping the sides and feet flat.
2. Lean back slightly and pull both knees toward your chest.
3. Extend your legs forward until almost straight and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a stable surface and place one hand lightly on it for support.
2. Place one foot directly in front of the other so the heel of the front foot touches the toes of the back foot.
3. Engage your core and hold the stance, then switch the leading foot.
Safety cue: Stack hips and shoulders while holding support and fix a steady gaze for balance

Health benefit: Builds core stability while reducing load on the spine
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Step your feet back while keeping your knees on the floor to form a straight line from head to knees.
3. Brace your core and keep hips level.
4. Hold the position while breathing steadily.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from knees to head and keep the core engaged

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductor muscles and improves lateral leg control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on one side with legs straight and head supported by your hand.
2. Lift the top leg up to hip height with toes pointing forward.
3. Lower the leg slowly and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and lift the top leg slowly without rolling the pelvis

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and warms upper body muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and extend your arms straight out to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Make small controlled circles forward for several repetitions.
3. Reverse the direction and make circles backward for the same amount of repetitions.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders relaxed and control the circles with smooth, consistent motion

Health benefit: Targets calf soleus flexibility and ankle dorsiflexion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place your hands on it at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back and bend both knees while keeping the back heel down.
3. Lean into the wall to feel the stretch in the lower calf, then switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and coordinated breathing
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with shoulders over wrists and hips over knees.
2. Inhale and drop your belly, lift your chest, and gaze forward (Cow).
3. Exhale and round your spine, tucking your chin and tailbone (Cat).
4. Continue flowing between the two positions with slow, controlled breaths.
Safety cue: Move with the breath, articulating the spine slowly through each round and arch

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and functional sit to stand ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in front of a chair with feet hip-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Push your hips back and bend your knees to lower until your butt lightly taps the chair.
3. Keep weight in your heels and chest lifted.
4. Push through your heels to stand tall and repeat.
Safety cue: Push hips back, keep knees tracking over toes, and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Increases hamstring flexibility and improves lower limb range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a chair with one leg extended and the heel on the floor, toes up.
2. Keep your back straight and hinge at the hips to lean forward toward the extended leg.
3. Reach toward the toes until you feel a stretch behind the thigh.
4. Hold the stretch for the desired time.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances core muscle control and trunk rotational endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with hands behind your head and knees bent.
2. Extend one leg while lifting the opposite shoulder blade and rotating toward the bent knee.
3. Switch sides slowly and maintain a controlled tempo.
4. Keep your neck neutral and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Press the lower back into the floor and move slowly with control through each rep

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular stabilizers and improves shoulder blade control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead in a Y and thumbs pointing up.
2. Lift your chest and arms a few inches off the floor by squeezing the shoulder blades.
3. Hold the raised position briefly and then lower with control.
Safety cue: Keep the neck neutral and retract the shoulder blades while lifting with controlled motion

Health benefit: Improves single leg stability and ankle proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair with feet flat and hands on the sides for support.
2. Lift one foot off the floor and extend the knee so the thigh is parallel to the floor.
3. Hold the position steady, then lower the foot and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Sit upright, engage your core and keep weight centered on the sitting bone

Health benefit: Opens chest and enhances anterior shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place one forearm on the frame with the elbow at shoulder height.
2. Step the corresponding foot forward slowly until you feel a stretch across the front of the chest.
3. Keep the torso upright and hold the stretch.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes hip flexor activation and increases lower limb circulation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat and hands resting on your hips.
2. Lift one knee toward your chest in a controlled motion and then lower it back down.
3. Alternate legs at a steady, controlled pace.
Safety cue: Sit tall, brace your core and lift each knee with slow controlled movement

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and supports lateral pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with hips stacked, knees bent, and feet together.
2. Keep feet touching and lift the top knee by opening the hip while keeping the pelvis stable.
3. Pause at the top, then lower the knee with control.
4. Repeat for reps then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and core braced while opening the top knee without rotating the pelvis

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and enhances trunk rotational range
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with hips over knees and place one hand behind your head and the other hand on the floor.
2. Rotate your torso toward the side with the lifted elbow, opening the chest upward.
3. Return the elbow toward the floor with control.
4. Repeat the rotation for the desired reps then switch sides.
Safety cue: Square the hips, rotate through the mid back and keep the lower spine stable

Health benefit: Challenges core endurance and promotes neutral spine stabilization
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hands under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Tuck your toes and lift the knees slightly off the floor to create a hover position.
3. Hold the hover while keeping a straight line from head to tail and steady breathing.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and brace the core to prevent sagging or arching

Health benefit: Targets triceps strength and improves elbow extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a stable chair and place hands beside your hips with fingers pointing forward.
2. Slide your hips forward off the chair and extend your legs in front with heels on the floor.
3. Bend your elbows to lower hips toward the floor while keeping shoulders down.
4. Push through your palms to straighten your arms and lift your hips back to the start.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances core activation and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet lifted off the floor.
2. Extend one leg straight while keeping the other knee bent.
3. Alternate legs in a slow circular pedaling motion.
4. Keep your lower back resting gently on the floor throughout.
Safety cue: Keep low back pressed into the mat while moving legs slowly

Health benefit: Improves quadriceps flexibility and knee extension range
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees stacked.
2. Reach back and grasp the top ankle or foot.
3. Gently pull the heel toward your butt until you feel a stretch.
Safety cue: Keep hips level while gently pulling your heel toward your glute

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and improves lateral pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with one hand on a chair or wall for support.
2. Keep the standing leg slightly bent and lift the other leg straight out to the side.
3. Lower the lifted leg with control and repeat for the other side.
Safety cue: Stand tall and lift your leg slowly without leaning your torso

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and coordination between limbs
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended toward the ceiling and knees bent at 90 degrees.
2. Slowly lower the opposite arm overhead while extending the opposite leg toward the floor.
3. Keep the lower back pressed gently into the floor.
4. Return to the start and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves cervical mobility and reduces neck stiffness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Slowly rotate your head to one side until it feels comfortable.
3. Rotate your head to the opposite side in a controlled motion and repeat.
Safety cue: Rotate your neck slowly within a comfortable range while keeping your chest lifted

Health benefit: Boosts light cardiovascular activity and shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit near the edge of a chair with feet together and hands at your sides.
2. Open your legs outward while bringing your arms out and slightly overhead.
3. Return your arms and legs to the starting position with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes thoracic mobility and shoulder blade retraction
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet slightly away from the wall.
2. Press your lower back, upper back, and head into the wall and raise your arms to form a "W."
3. Slide your arms upward into a "Y" while keeping contact with the wall.
4. Slowly lower back to the "W" position and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Encourages spinal lengthening and gentle posterior chain relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on the floor with big toes touching and knees apart.
2. Sit back toward your heels and stretch your arms forward on the floor.
3. Rest your forehead on the ground and hold the position while breathing.
Safety cue: Sink hips back toward your heels and breathe deeply while lengthening the spine

Health benefit: Builds lateral core strength with lower back support
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side and prop your upper body on your forearm with knees bent and stacked.
2. Lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Hold briefly, then lower with control and switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops upper body strength with reduced shoulder strain
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a sturdy table or counter and place your hands shoulder-width apart on the edge.
2. Walk your feet back so your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Bend your elbows and lower your chest toward the surface in a controlled motion.
4. Push back up to the starting position and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves ankle range of motion and promotes local circulation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall at the edge of the chair with feet flat on the floor.
2. Lift one foot a few inches off the floor and point toes.
3. Rotate the ankle slowly clockwise in smooth circles.
4. Reverse the rotation and repeat in the opposite direction.
Safety cue: Rotate the ankle slowly with control while keeping the thigh supported

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal muscles and improves core endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with forehead resting on folded hands.
2. Lift both legs a few inches off the floor and keep them straight.
3. Alternate quick, small kicks with each leg while maintaining height.
4. Keep the hips pressed to the floor and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases inner thigh flexibility and improves hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall and bring the soles of the feet together.
2. Hold the feet with both hands and open the knees outward.
3. Gently lean forward from the hips with a straight back to deepen the stretch.
Safety cue: Sit tall with a neutral spine and lower the knees gently while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and improves proprioceptive control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a chair and hold the backrest with one hand.
2. Shift weight onto one foot and lift the other foot to rest on the inner calf or thigh.
3. Square the hips and engage the core to maintain balance.
4. Hold the position and then switch to the other leg.
Safety cue: Keep the standing knee slightly bent and engage your core to maintain hip alignment

Health benefit: Strengthens back extensors and supports upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Lift the chest, arms, and legs simultaneously a few inches off the floor.
3. Squeeze the glutes and shoulder blades together to hold the position.
Safety cue: Lift chest and legs using glutes and scapular control while keeping the neck neutral

Health benefit: Boosts cardiovascular activity while improving upper body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with feet flat and hands in front as if guarding.
2. Rotate the torso and extend a controlled jab with one arm.
3. Follow with a cross from the other arm while keeping hands up.
4. Maintain a steady rhythm and relax the shoulders between punches.
Safety cue: Sit tall, brace your core, and rotate through the torso with controlled punches

Health benefit: Improves shoulder blade stability and contributes to better posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Pull the shoulder blades together and down toward the spine.
3. Release the shoulders to a neutral position with control.
Safety cue: Retract shoulder blades back and down without shrugging while keeping the neck relaxed

Health benefit: Lengthens hip flexors and reduces anterior hip tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with one knee on the floor and the other foot planted forward.
2. Tuck the pelvis and shift the hips forward until you feel a stretch in the front of the hip.
3. Keep the torso upright and squeeze the glutes of the trailing leg.
4. Hold the stretch and then switch to the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and promotes ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place one hand lightly on it for support.
2. Shift weight onto one foot and place the opposite foot on the inner calf or thigh.
3. Press the palms together at chest level and lift the chest, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Targets lower abdominal muscles and improves core strength
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Curl the knees toward the chest by lifting the hips off the floor.
3. Lower the hips and legs back down with control.
4. Keep the core engaged and avoid using momentum.
Safety cue: Curl the pelvis upward using the lower abs and perform each rep slowly and controlled

Health benefit: Strengthens intrinsic foot muscles and improves foot stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit in a chair with a towel laid flat under one foot.
2. Curl your toes to grab and pull the towel toward you.
3. Release the towel and repeat or switch feet.
Safety cue: Keep ankle stable and curl toes slowly with control

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and postural endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Begin kneeling and place forearms on the floor under your shoulders.
2. Lift hips so your body forms a straight line from head to knees.
3. Engage your core and keep your neck neutral.
4. Hold the position and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to knees and brace the core

Health benefit: Improves lateral trunk flexibility and engages oblique muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and hands at your sides.
2. Raise one arm overhead and lean the torso toward the opposite side.
3. Return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Sit tall, hinge from the waist and bend with controlled motion

Health benefit: Promotes shoulder mobility and activates shoulder stabilizing muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet shoulder-width and arms at your sides.
2. Lift both arms out to the sides to shoulder height with palms facing down.
3. Keep a slight bend in the elbows and a tall posture.
4. Lower the arms slowly back to your sides.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and raise arms slowly to shoulder height

Health benefit: Improves functional lower body strength and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in front of a chair with feet hip-width and arms forward.
2. Sit hips back and bend knees until your glutes lightly touch the chair.
3. Keep weight in the heels and chest lifted.
4. Press through the heels to stand back up.
Safety cue: Push hips back, keep chest up and control the descent without letting knees pass toes

Health benefit: Enhances circulation and hip flexor activation while improving coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with feet flat and hands on your thighs.
2. Lift one knee toward your chest, then lower it.
3. Alternate knees in a steady marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Sit upright, engage the core and lift knees with steady control

Health benefit: Improves balance and proprioceptive awareness with minimal support
Steps to perform:
1. Stand next to a wall and place one hand lightly on it for support.
2. Place one foot directly in front of the other so the heel touches the toes of the back foot.
3. Maintain an upright posture and hold, then switch the leading foot.
Safety cue: Stack feet heel-to-toe, use the wall for light support and keep a steady gaze

Health benefit: Increases spinal mobility and encourages gentle core engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Drop your belly, lift your chest, and gaze forward for cow.
3. Round your spine, tuck your chin, and pull your belly in for cat.
4. Alternate smoothly between the two positions.
Safety cue: Move slowly through each articulation, coordinating spinal movement with steady breathing

Health benefit: Improves hamstring flexibility and posterior chain length
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a chair and extend one leg straight with heel on the floor.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach toward your toes while keeping your back straight.
3. Hold the stretch and then switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds upper body strength and improves scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place hands on the wall at shoulder height and width.
2. Step feet back so your body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Bend your elbows and lean your chest toward the wall.
4. Push back to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep body straight, draw shoulder blades down and press with controlled tempo

Health benefit: Improves lateral coordination and promotes gentle cardiovascular activity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand upright beside a wall with feet together and place one hand lightly on the wall.
2. Step sideways with one foot and shift your weight onto that foot.
3. Bring the other foot to meet the stepping foot and tap the floor.
4. Repeat the step-touch in the opposite direction while keeping light contact with the wall.
Safety cue: Keep spine tall and core braced while stepping with controlled movements

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Stand behind a sturdy chair and hold the backrest with both hands.
2. Shift your weight onto one leg and lift the other foot a few inches off the floor.
3. Hold your balance for the desired time while keeping the standing leg slightly bent.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and weight centered over the standing foot

Health benefit: Increases shoulder mobility and warms upper body muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with arms extended to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Make small controlled circles with both arms forward for the chosen count.
3. Reverse the direction and make small controlled circles backward for the same count.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and move with controlled small circles

Health benefit: Improves spinal mobility and reduces upper back stiffness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat and hands behind your head.
2. Rotate your upper torso to one side using your thoracic spine while keeping hips facing forward.
3. Hold the rotated position briefly while breathing steadily.
4. Return to center and perform the rotation to the other side.
Safety cue: Sit tall and rotate from the upper back while keeping the core engaged

Health benefit: Enhances calf flexibility and ankle range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back keeping that heel flat and the back leg straight.
3. Lean forward into the wall until you feel a stretch in the back calf.
4. Switch legs and repeat the stretch on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep front knee slightly bent and press the back heel into the floor

Health benefit: Strengthens glutes and supports hip stability during movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet hip-width on the floor.
2. Press through your heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Squeeze your glutes at the top and hold briefly.
4. Lower your hips slowly back to the floor.
Safety cue: Lift hips by squeezing glutes and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves calf strength and promotes ankle stability for walking
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a support and hold it lightly with both hands at hip height.
2. Rise onto the balls of your feet by lifting both heels off the ground.
3. Lower your heels back down with control and repeat the movement.
Safety cue: Rise slowly through the balls of the feet and control the descent

Health benefit: Enhances core mobility and gentle rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and hands resting gently on your thighs or crossed over your chest.
2. Rotate your torso to one side from the waist while keeping your hips square.
3. Return to center and rotate to the other side in a controlled manner.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and rotate from the mid back without collapsing forward

Health benefit: Boosts upper body coordination and elevates heart rate modestly
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with feet flat and hands up near your chin in a guarded position.
2. Extend one arm forward in a quick, controlled punch while rotating your torso slightly.
3. Return the hand to guard and repeat the punch with the other arm in a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain upright posture, tuck the chin slightly and breathe steadily between punches

Health benefit: Builds core stability and reduces lower back strain during activities
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and place your forearms on the floor with elbows under your shoulders.
2. Step your hips back and lift your torso so your body forms a straight line from head to knees.
3. Engage your core and hold the position while breathing steadily.
4. Lower your hips to the floor to rest when finished.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and hips in line with shoulders to avoid sagging or piking

Health benefit: Gently lengthens the spine and promotes relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and bring your big toes together while sitting back on your heels.
2. Reach your arms forward and lower your chest toward the floor.
3. Rest your forehead on the mat and lengthen your spine.
Safety cue: Breathe deeply while drawing hips back and lengthening the spine

Health benefit: Improves lower body stability and lateral weight distribution control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a wide stance and feet pointing forward.
2. Shift your weight to the right leg and bend the right knee.
3. Return to center and shift weight to the left leg.
4. Repeat the weight shifts in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and shift smoothly without rotating the spine

Health benefit: Strengthens core muscles and enhances seated trunk control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a chair with feet flat on the floor.
2. Hold the sides of the chair and lean back slightly.
3. Pull both knees toward your chest.
4. Extend your legs forward slowly without touching the floor.
Safety cue: Sit tall, brace the core, and exhale as you draw knees toward the chest

Health benefit: Increases neck mobility and reduces muscle tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with your spine straight.
2. Drop your right ear toward your right shoulder and hold.
3. Return to center.
4. Drop your left ear toward your left shoulder and hold.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders relaxed and tilt the head slowly within a comfortable range

Health benefit: Opens the chest and improves shoulder girdle flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place your forearms on the frame at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot forward and lean your chest through the opening.
3. Keep your shoulders down and feel the stretch across the chest.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and retract the shoulder blades as you open the chest

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and coordination between limbs
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Extend your right arm forward and your left leg back until they form a straight line.
3. Hold with hips square and core engaged.
4. Return to hands and knees and repeat with the opposite arm and leg.
Safety cue: Brace the core and extend opposite arm and leg slowly while keeping hips level

Health benefit: Improves balance and proprioceptive awareness during slow gait practice
Steps to perform:
1. Stand next to a wall and lightly rest one hand on it for support.
2. Place one foot directly in front of the other so the heel touches the toe.
3. Take slow, deliberate steps while maintaining an upright posture.
Safety cue: Stand tall, look forward, and place each heel directly in front of the toe

Health benefit: Elevates heart rate gently while challenging hip flexor strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a sturdy support and hold it with both hands.
2. Lift your right knee slowly toward your chest while keeping your torso upright.
3. Lower the right knee and lift the left knee in the same slow manner.
4. Continue alternating knees at a controlled, marching pace.
Safety cue: Lift knees with control, keep the torso upright, and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Increases shoulder mobility and relieves upper back tension
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with your shoulders relaxed.
2. Lift both shoulders toward your ears.
3. Roll your shoulders back and down in a smooth circle.
4. Repeat the motion rolling the shoulders forward in the opposite direction.
Safety cue: Keep the neck long and roll shoulders slowly through a full controlled arc

Health benefit: Improves inner thigh flexibility and encourages hip opening
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall and bring the soles of your feet together with knees falling outward.
2. Hold your feet or ankles and draw your heels toward your groin.
3. Gently press your knees toward the floor with your elbows and hold.
Safety cue: Sit tall, hinge from the hips, and gently press knees toward the floor with control

Health benefit: Builds quadriceps endurance and enhances lower body isometric strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet hip-width apart about 2 feet from the wall.
2. Slide your back down the wall until your knees bend to about 90 degrees.
3. Hold the position with weight in your heels and back flat against the wall.
4. Press through your heels to stand back up.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and improves unilateral shoulder control
Steps to perform:
1. Get on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Extend one arm straight forward to shoulder height while keeping hips level.
3. Lower the arm back to the starting position and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and lift the arm without rotating the hips

Health benefit: Raises heart rate gently and improves coordination and mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Step one foot out to the side while raising both arms overhead.
3. Step the foot back to center as you lower the arms and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases hip mobility and promotes controlled hip joint range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand next to a stable surface and place one hand lightly for support.
2. Shift your weight to the standing leg and move the opposite hip in a circular motion.
3. Reverse the circle direction after several reps and then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and perform slow controlled circles without shifting the torso

Health benefit: Improves triceps flexibility and enhances shoulder overhead range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and raise one arm overhead.
2. Bend the raised elbow and reach the hand toward the upper back.
3. Use the opposite hand to gently press the bent elbow downward.
4. Hold the stretch and then switch arms.
Safety cue: Keep the shoulder blade down and back while reaching the elbow overhead

Health benefit: Develops upper body pushing strength with reduced joint load
Steps to perform:
1. Place your hands shoulder-width on a stable elevated surface.
2. Step your feet back into a straight plank line.
3. Bend your elbows to lower your chest toward the surface.
4. Push through your palms to straighten your arms and return to start.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels and lower with controlled descent

Health benefit: Challenges core stability and improves seated balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the edge of a stable chair with feet flat and hands on the sides for support.
2. Lean back slightly, engage your core, and lift your feet a few inches off the floor.
3. Rock backward and forward using your core while maintaining light hand support.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral spine and move from the core without letting the ribs flare

Health benefit: Promotes hamstring activation and increases lower body dynamic flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a stable surface and hold it lightly for balance.
2. March in place by bringing one heel up toward the glute.
3. Alternate legs rhythmically while keeping a light grip on the support.
Safety cue: Stand tall holding support and kick the heel toward the glute with controlled motion

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular muscles and supports improved upper back posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades together without lifting your shoulders.
3. Hold the squeeze briefly and then release.
Safety cue: Pull the shoulder blades down and together without shrugging the shoulders

Health benefit: Encourages spinal extension mobility and opens the chest and front shoulders
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with hands under your shoulders and legs extended.
2. Press into your hands to lift your chest while keeping your hips on the floor.
3. Hold the lifted position briefly and then lower back down.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and outer thigh muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs stacked and head supported by your arm or a pillow.
2. Lift the top leg up to hip height with toes pointing forward and knee straight.
3. Lower the top leg slowly without letting it touch the bottom leg.
4. Repeat the lift for the desired number of repetitions.
Safety cue: Stack your hips and brace the core to prevent rolling

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and coordinated reach control while maintaining balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a chair or wall and place one hand on it for support.
2. Place feet hip-width and step the working foot forward to a 12 o'clock position.
3. Reach the opposite arm forward toward the stepped foot while keeping the torso upright.
4. Return to center and repeat reaches to other clock positions as needed.
Safety cue: Keep a tall spine and reach with control from your supporting hand

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder endurance and core rotational stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and knees slightly bent, hands held at chin level.
2. Rotate the torso and extend the right fist across the midline in a controlled motion.
3. Return the right hand to the start and alternate by punching with the left fist.
Safety cue: Rotate through the torso and keep the core braced during each punch

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and improves torso flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright on a chair or mat with both feet flat on the floor.
2. Place the right hand on the outside of the left thigh and the left hand behind you on the seat or floor.
3. Rotate the torso to the left using the hands for gentle leverage and hold the position.
Safety cue: Sit tall, lengthen the spine, and initiate the twist from the mid back

Health benefit: Increases thigh flexibility and improves knee range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees slightly bent and hips stacked.
2. Bend the top knee and reach back to grasp the ankle with the same-side hand.
3. Gently pull the heel toward the glutes while keeping hips aligned.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves core stability and limb coordination during controlled movements
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended toward the ceiling and knees bent at 90 degrees.
2. Press the lower back into the floor and engage the core to stabilize the spine.
3. Slowly lower the right arm overhead while extending the left leg toward the floor.
4. Return to the start and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Press the lower back into the floor and move arms and legs slowly and deliberately

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and ankle stability with supported alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a wall and place one hand on it for light support.
2. Shift weight onto one foot and place the sole of the opposite foot on the inner calf or thigh.
3. Bring the free hand to the chest or overhead and lengthen the spine while balancing.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves lower leg agility and quick foot coordination while seated
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat and knees bent at 90 degrees.
2. Quickly lift and lower the heels while keeping the toes on the floor.
3. Increase speed to a controlled fast pace while maintaining an upright posture.
Safety cue: Sit tall, engage your core, and move the feet lightly and quickly with control

Health benefit: Promotes pelvic mobility and encourages gentle core muscle activation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Tilt the pelvis posteriorly to flatten the lower back against the floor while engaging the abdominals.
3. Release to a neutral spine and repeat the tilting motion slowly.
Safety cue: Tilt from the pelvis with slow controlled breaths and avoid thrusting the hips

Health benefit: Improves lateral trunk flexibility and stretches the oblique muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and arms at your sides or overhead.
2. Reach one arm overhead and slide it down the side of the body while bending toward the opposite side.
3. Return to center and repeat the side bend on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep ribs stacked over hips and reach through the side without collapsing the opposite side

Health benefit: Enhances scapular stability and upper back muscle endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms overhead in a Y and palms facing down.
2. Squeeze shoulder blades and lift arms and chest a few inches off the ground.
3. Hold for a second while keeping the neck neutral.
4. Lower slowly back to the ground with control.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and lift through the shoulder blades with controlled motion

Health benefit: Improves balance and coordination while activating hip flexor muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and weight evenly distributed.
2. Lift one knee toward hip level while swinging the opposite arm.
3. Lower the foot back down and immediately lift the other knee.
4. Continue alternating at a steady, controlled pace.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and core engaged while marching with steady controlled steps

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and thoracic spine extension
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet a few inches forward.
2. Press lower back, head, and arms against the wall in a goalpost position.
3. Slide your arms up overhead while keeping contact with the wall.
4. Slide your arms back down while maintaining shoulder blade control.
Safety cue: Press lower back lightly to the wall and slide arms slowly maintaining scapular contact

Health benefit: Builds quadriceps strength and enhances knee joint control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall in a chair with feet flat and hands on the sides.
2. Extend one leg forward until the knee is straight but not locked.
3. Hold for a second and squeeze the quadriceps.
4. Lower the foot back to the floor with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Extend the leg slowly keeping the knee soft and core braced

Health benefit: Activates core muscles and enhances pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Lift shoulders slightly and reach one hand to tap the outer side of the same-side heel.
3. Return to center and alternate taps on the other side in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep lower back grounded and hinge from the hips for slow controlled heel taps

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and balance with assisted support
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall holding onto a stable surface for support.
