1. Stand tall with feet together and hands on hips.
2. Step your right foot out to the right side.
3. Cross your left foot behind the right and step right again.
4. Bring the left foot to meet the right and reset your weight.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright torso and step with control keeping hips level

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and releases upper back tension
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Lift both shoulders up toward your ears.
3. Roll the shoulders back and down in a smooth circle.
Safety cue: Roll the shoulders slowly through full range and keep the neck relaxed

Health benefit: Increases neck extension range and supports head alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with a neutral spine.
2. Tilt your head backward and lift your chin toward the ceiling.
3. Hold the position briefly and return your head to neutral.
Safety cue: Keep the spine neutral and extend the neck slowly without forcing the movement

Health benefit: Challenges core stability and balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the mat with knees bent and feet flat, holding your shins.
2. Lean back slightly and lift your feet so your shins are parallel to the floor.
3. Rock back onto your tailbone and then forward onto your sit bones.
4. Repeat the rocking motion with controlled movements.
Safety cue: Brace the core and control the rocking motion without arching the lower back

Health benefit: Builds core strength and enhances trunk endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Place forearms on the floor with elbows under shoulders.
2. Extend legs and balance on toes so your body forms a straight line.
3. Engage your core and hold the straight position.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops lower body endurance and quadriceps strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall and feet hip-width apart.
2. Slide down the wall until your knees form about a 90-degree angle.
3. Hold the seated position with weight in your heels.
Safety cue: Keep knees aligned over ankles and press the lower back flat against the wall

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular stabilizers and improves shoulder posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with elbows bent and hands near your shoulders in a W shape.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift your forearms and chest off the floor.
3. Lower back down with control.
Safety cue: Squeeze the shoulder blades and lift with control while keeping the neck neutral

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and rhythmic coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Lift your right knee toward your chest while driving your opposite arm forward.
3. Lower the right foot and lift the left knee in the same controlled manner.
4. Maintain a slow, steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright posture and lift knees with controlled hip flexion and steady breathing

Health benefit: Enhances lateral agility and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with knees slightly bent and hips low.
2. Take a quick side step to the right, then follow with the left foot.
3. Reverse the direction by shuffling to the left and continue alternating.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Promotes neck mobility and gentle muscular relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with your spine straight.
2. Drop your chin to your chest and slowly roll your head to the right shoulder.
3. Continue the roll to the back, then to the left shoulder, and return to the chest.
Safety cue: Move the neck slowly in a controlled circle while keeping the shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and releases upper back tension
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall or sit upright.
2. Lift shoulders toward ears, then roll them back and down in a smooth circle.
3. Repeat several times, then reverse the direction.
Safety cue: Keep neck long and roll shoulders in slow controlled circles

Health benefit: Increases hamstring flexibility and promotes hip extension range
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with both legs extended.
2. Loop a strap or hold behind one thigh and lift that leg toward the ceiling.
3. Keep the lifted leg straight with a soft knee and feel the stretch in the hamstring.
4. Lower the leg with control and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep lower back grounded and hinge from the hip to stretch the hamstring

Health benefit: Enhances lateral core stability and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with forearm under your shoulder and elbow aligned.
2. Press forearm into the floor and lift hips until your body forms a straight line.
3. Keep hips stacked and core engaged.
4. Lower hips with control and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep body in a straight line and brace the core

Health benefit: Improves standing balance and ankle proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Shift weight onto one foot and lift the other foot off the ground with a bent knee.
3. Maintain an upright posture and steady breathing.
4. Lower the foot with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep standing knee slightly bent and hips level while focusing on a fixed point

Health benefit: Promotes scapular mobility and thoracic extension for better posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back and head against a wall and feet a few inches away.
2. Press your lower back, upper back, and arms into the wall in a goalpost position.
3. Slide your arms up overhead while keeping contact with the wall.
4. Reverse the motion and return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep head and lower back against the wall and slide arms slowly with control

Health benefit: Strengthens glute muscles and supports hip extension during movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat hip-width apart.
2. Press through your heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to knees.
3. Squeeze your glutes at the top while keeping your core engaged.
4. Lower your hips with control back to the floor.
Safety cue: Drive through the heels and squeeze glutes at the top while keeping hips level

Health benefit: Improves core stability and coordination with controlled limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet lifted so shins are parallel to the floor.
2. Cross your arms over your chest and brace your core to flatten your lower back.
3. Slowly extend one leg toward the floor while keeping the other knee bent.
4. Return the extended leg to the start and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases light cardiovascular activity and enhances lower limb coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed.
2. Lift one knee toward hip height while maintaining an upright posture.
3. Lower that foot and immediately lift the other knee in a marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Stand tall, lift knees with control and breathe steadily

Health benefit: Boosts lateral movement coordination and maintains light aerobic activity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and knees slightly bent.
2. Step to the side with one foot and bring the other foot to meet it.
3. Continue alternating sides in a controlled, rhythmic step-touch pattern.
Safety cue: Step with control, keep knees soft and maintain upright posture

Health benefit: Improves trunk rotational mobility and increases seated spinal range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with feet flat on the floor and hands on your shoulders or clasped.
2. Rotate your torso to one side from the ribs while keeping your hips facing forward.
3. Return to center and rotate to the other side.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves hip mobility and joint lubrication
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands on hips.
2. Shift weight to one leg and lift the opposite knee.
3. Rotate the lifted leg in a slow circular motion from the hip.
4. Reverse the circle direction after a set of repetitions.
Safety cue: Brace your core and move the hips in slow controlled circles

Health benefit: Increases quadriceps flexibility and knee range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall on one leg with the other foot relaxed.
2. Bend the free knee and reach back to grasp the ankle.
3. Pull the ankle toward the glute and keep knees close.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and pull heel to glute while maintaining a neutral spine

Health benefit: Enhances forearm and wrist flexibility and reduces muscle tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place one forearm on the doorframe at shoulder height.
2. Step the same foot forward until you feel a stretch across the front of the shoulder and chest.
3. Hold the position and breathe steadily.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and press forearms into the doorway with control to open the chest

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and postural stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot directly in front of the other, heel touching toe.
2. Keep hips level and arms relaxed at your sides or extended for balance.
3. Hold the stance and focus on a steady gaze.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances balance and core engagement while promoting body awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one leg.
2. Place the sole of the other foot against the inner calf or thigh.
3. Bring both palms to your heart center.
4. Hold the pose and keep your gaze steady.
Safety cue: Ground the standing foot, engage your core, and keep hips level with hands at heart

Health benefit: Improves calf strength and ankle push off power
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hands at your sides or on hips.
2. Rise onto the balls of your feet by lifting both heels.
3. Lower your heels back down with control.
Safety cue: Keep a tall spine and lower back down with control on each calf raise

Health benefit: Enhances upper back posture and shoulder blade stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades together without lifting your shoulders.
3. Hold briefly and then release slowly.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together without shrugging and keep the neck long

Health benefit: Boosts lateral coordination and lower body mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and hands on your hips.
2. Step the right foot diagonally outward to form half of a V.
3. Return the right foot to center.
4. Repeat the same step with the left foot to complete the V pattern.
Safety cue: Step in a controlled V pattern keeping hips level and hands on hips for stability

Health benefit: Strengthens front lower leg muscles and improves ankle control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with weight evenly distributed.
2. Extend one leg forward with the heel touching the floor and toes pointed up.
3. Push the heel into the floor and then return the foot to the starting position.
Safety cue: Keep toes up and drive the heel forward while maintaining a tall posture

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and gentle flexion and extension of the back
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on a chair with feet flat and hands on your knees.
2. Inhale and arch your spine while lifting your chest and looking slightly upward.
3. Exhale and round your spine while tucking your chin toward your chest.
4. Continue alternating the arch and round in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Coordinate slow breaths with each arch and round while controlling movement from the pelvis

Health benefit: Improves ankle mobility and balance awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand and lift one foot off the ground.
2. Rotate the ankle slowly clockwise.
3. Reverse direction and rotate counterclockwise.
4. Repeat with the other foot.
Safety cue: Rotate the ankle slowly with control and keep the movement smooth

Health benefit: Increases lateral neck flexibility and reduces stiffness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Tilt your head toward one shoulder until you feel a gentle stretch.
3. Return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Tilt the head slowly keeping the chin level and shoulders relaxed

Health benefit: Enhances groin and inner thigh flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall and bring the soles of your feet together.
2. Hold your feet and let your knees fall toward the floor.
3. Keep your back straight and lean forward slightly.
4. Hold the position and then release.
Safety cue: Sit tall and hinge from the hips while gently pressing knees toward the floor

Health benefit: Develops single-leg balance and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto one foot.
2. Lift the opposite foot and place it against the inner calf or ankle.
3. Keep hips level and hands on hips or raised for balance.
Safety cue: Balance on one leg with a soft knee and hips level

Health benefit: Improves walking stability and lower limb coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and take a step forward placing heel first.
2. Roll through the foot to the toes and push off to bring the back foot forward.
3. Continue placing each foot heel-to-toe in a straight line.
Safety cue: Step heel to toe with eyes forward and core engaged

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and spinal extensor endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms positioned slightly back at your sides.
2. Lift your chest, arms, and legs off the floor while keeping your neck neutral.
3. Squeeze your glutes and shoulder blades together.
4. Lower down with control.
Safety cue: Lift chest and legs using glutes while keeping the neck neutral

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and step one foot back into a split stance.
2. Bend both knees slightly to lower into a shallow lunge.
3. Keep your torso upright and core engaged.
4. Hold the position then switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep the front knee over the ankle and maintain an upright torso

Health benefit: Targets abdominal endurance and trunk flexion control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and arms crossed over your chest.
2. Engage your core and lift your shoulders off the floor using your abs.
3. Lower your shoulders back down with control.
Safety cue: Exhale as you curl using your abs and keep the lower back grounded

Health benefit: Enhances lateral power and dynamic balance with reduced joint stress
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and take a lateral step to one side while sweeping the opposite foot behind.
2. Bend into a soft knee and push off to the other side.
3. Swing your arms naturally to help balance.
4. Continue side-to-side at a controlled pace.
Safety cue: Push laterally with controlled steps and maintain stable hips

Health benefit: Improves aerobic capacity and calorie expenditure
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and march quickly in place lifting your knees.
2. Pump your arms and land softly on the midfoot.
3. Maintain an upright posture and a brisk, steady pace.
Safety cue: Walk in place with an upright posture and steady breathing

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and upper back rotational range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and the bottom arm extended under your head.
2. Place the top hand on your chest or extend it toward the ceiling.
3. Rotate your thorax to open the top arm toward the floor behind you while keeping hips stacked.
4. Return the arm to the starting position and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and rotate through the upper back while breathing steadily

Health benefit: Enhances awareness of pelvic positioning and lower back flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Tilt your pelvis to press your lower back gently into the floor.
3. Relax to return to a neutral spine and repeat.
Safety cue: Brace your core and tilt from the pelvis to flatten the lower back

Health benefit: Improves shoulder and triceps flexibility for reaching movements
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and raise one arm overhead.
2. Bend the raised elbow and reach the hand down toward your upper back.
3. Use the opposite hand to gently pull the elbow back and hold.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and a neutral spine while reaching the elbow overhead

Health benefit: Promotes gentle spinal lengthening and shoulder extension
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with toes together and sit back toward your heels.
2. Walk your hands back along your sides toward your feet with palms up.
3. Lower your chest toward your thighs and relax your shoulders.
4. Hold the position.
Safety cue: Anchor your hips back and reach through the fingertips while breathing deeply

Health benefit: Improves single-leg balance and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto one foot.
2. Bend the opposite knee and lift the foot toward your glute.
3. Extend your arms for balance and hold.
Safety cue: Keep the standing knee soft, hips level, and maintain a steady gaze for balance

Health benefit: Enhances core stability and dynamic balance control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on your sit bones with knees bent and feet lifted off the floor.
2. Extend your arms forward and lean back to balance in a boat position.
3. Rock backward so your shoulders lower toward the floor while maintaining core tension.
4. Rock forward to return to the balanced boat position and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and control the rocking motion from your core

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior shoulder and upper back muscles to support posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms at your sides and palms down.
2. Lift your chest and head off the floor while squeezing your shoulder blades down and together.
3. Hold the lifted position briefly and lower slowly back down.
Safety cue: Retract the shoulder blades to lift the chest and avoid overarching the lower back

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductor muscles and improves lateral hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on one side with legs straight and stacked.
2. Lift the top leg upward without rolling your hips forward or back.
3. Lower the leg with control to the starting position and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves lower body strength and functional stair climbing ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a stable step or bench and place one foot on the step.
2. Push through the heel of the planted foot to lift your body up onto the step.
3. Step back down with control and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and prepares upper body for activity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and extend both arms straight out to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Make small controlled circles with your arms forward for the desired time.
3. Reverse the direction and make small controlled circles backward for the same time.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and perform slow, controlled circles from the shoulder joint

Health benefit: Improves lumbar mobility and stretches gluteal muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with legs extended.
2. Bend one knee and draw it toward your chest.
3. Wrap your hands around the shin and pull gently until you feel a stretch.
4. Hold, then lower the leg with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases hamstring flexibility and promotes spinal flexion
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with legs extended and feet flexed.
2. Hinge at the hips and reach toward your toes.
3. Keep a long spine and avoid rounding excessively.
4. Hold, then slowly roll up to sit.
Safety cue: Hinge from the hips with a long spine and lead the movement from your chest

Health benefit: Enhances hip mobility and lower limb coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one leg straight and the other knee bent.
2. Lift the straight leg to hip height and point the toes.
3. Reach the raised leg slowly toward selected clock positions with control.
4. Lower the leg and switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds core stability and improves abdominal endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms by your sides and legs extended.
2. Lift your head, shoulders, and legs a few inches off the floor while pressing your lower back into the ground.
3. Keep the arms long on the floor and maintain a hollow core position.
4. Hold, then lower with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens deep neck flexors and promotes better head and neck alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Gently tuck your chin toward your chest by sliding the head back into the surface.
3. Hold briefly then relax and repeat with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Gently tuck your chin and lengthen the back of the neck without lifting the head

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular stabilizers and enhances shoulder mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms overhead in a Y and thumbs pointing up.
2. Lift your arms and chest a few inches off the ground using your upper back.
3. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and keep your neck neutral.
4. Lower slowly with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep a neutral neck and lift through the shoulder blades rather than extending the neck

Health benefit: Improves cardiovascular endurance and whole body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and hands at chest.
2. Step one foot out to the side while opening both arms out wide.
3. Step back to center and bring the arms back to the chest.
4. Repeat on the other side in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Move with control and land softly while keeping your chest lifted and hips stable

Health benefit: Opens the chest and improves anterior shoulder flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place one forearm against the frame with elbow at shoulder height.
2. Step forward with the same-side foot until you feel a stretch in the front chest.
3. Hold briefly then switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and encourages upright chest posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one foot.
2. Lift the other foot slightly off the ground and draw the shoulder blades together to open the chest.
3. Extend the arms out to the sides or clasp behind your back to increase chest opening.
4. Hold with steady breathing then switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves scapular mobility and promotes better shoulder mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with your back and hips against a wall and arms raised in a goalpost position.
2. Press your entire arms, wrists, and lower back into the wall.
3. Slowly slide your arms up overhead while keeping contact with the wall.
4. Return to the starting position with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves coordination and encourages upright posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Lift one knee while reaching both arms forward.
3. Open arms wide and squeeze shoulder blades as you step down.
4. Alternate legs in a controlled marching rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep tall posture and squeeze shoulder blades as you lift each knee

Health benefit: Increases spinal mobility and encourages gentle movement awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Arch your back and lift your chest and tailbone.
3. Round your back and tuck your chin and tailbone.
4. Move slowly between positions with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Coordinate slow breaths with spinal flexion and extension, moving with control

Health benefit: Opens the chest and improves shoulder range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and clasp hands behind your back.
2. Straighten arms and lift your chest while squeezing shoulder blades.
3. Draw shoulders down and hold the open-chest position.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and draw shoulder blades together while clasping hands behind

Health benefit: Enhances balance and reinforces proper shoulder alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot directly in front of the other heel-to-toe.
2. Roll shoulders back and down and lift your chest.
3. Maintain balance and switch the front foot as needed.
Safety cue: Stack hips and shoulders, lift the chest and keep shoulders down and back

Health benefit: Strengthens upper back muscles to support better posture
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms at your sides and forehead on the floor.
2. Lift your chest slightly and engage your glutes.
3. Sweep arms overhead keeping them off the ground and squeeze shoulder blades.
4. Reverse the motion to return arms to your sides with control.
Safety cue: Keep neck neutral and glide shoulder blades together with controlled movements

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength while encouraging upright torso alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a stable step or bench with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step up with one foot and press through the heel while lifting your chest.
3. Bring the trailing foot up fully and stand tall.
4. Step down with control and alternate legs.
Safety cue: Drive through the heel, keep hips level and maintain an upright torso

Health benefit: Improves thoracic mobility and reduces forward rounding
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall and place hands behind your head with elbows wide.
2. Arch your upper spine over the chair back while keeping hips neutral.
3. Return to upright and repeat with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Anchor midback on the chair, lift the chest and keep the neck long

Health benefit: Improves neck flexibility and decreases trapezius tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and grasp the side of your head with one hand.
2. Gently pull your head toward the same-side shoulder while keeping the opposite shoulder down.
3. Hold the stretch and then repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down and gently draw the opposite shoulder down while lengthening the neck

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and strengthens posterior chain stabilizers
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one hand on a support and hinge at the hips with the other arm extended forward.
2. Lean forward until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor while lifting the rear leg and keeping hips square.
3. Hold the position in a straight line from head to lifted heel and then return to standing.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves core stability and coordinates opposite limb movement
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Extend one arm forward and the opposite leg back until both are parallel to the floor.
3. Keep hips level and squeeze glutes and shoulder blade.
4. Lower slowly and switch sides.
Safety cue: Brace the core and extend opposite arm and leg with slow controlled movement

Health benefit: Improves hamstring activation and light cardiovascular warmup
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed.
2. Jog in place while lifting each heel toward the glutes.
3. Keep your torso upright and land softly on the balls of your feet.
4. Pump your arms naturally as you alternate heels to glutes.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and chest tall

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic spine mobility and rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and arms extended in front.
2. Reach the top arm toward the ceiling and place the palm by your ear.
3. Rotate the top arm open across your body while keeping hips stacked.
4. Return the arm to the start position and repeat slowly.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and rotate through the thoracic spine

Health benefit: Increases hip flexor length and anterior hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel with one knee on the ground and the other foot flat in front.
2. Tuck the pelvis slightly and press the hips forward gently.
3. Keep your torso upright and engage your core.
4. Hold the position and switch sides after the desired time.
Safety cue: Tuck the pelvis and maintain a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance while promoting scapular stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto one leg.
2. Lift the other foot to rest at the ankle or shin and set the scapula by squeezing the shoulder blades together and down.
3. Hold your balance for the desired time then switch sides.
Safety cue: Stand tall on one leg with shoulders down and shoulder blades engaged

Health benefit: Enhances shoulder mobility and promotes thoracic extension awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Press your lower back and arms into the floor and start with arms at your sides.
3. Slide your arms overhead keeping contact with the floor as long as possible.
4. Reverse the motion to return to the start and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep the lower back lightly on the floor and move arms slowly

Health benefit: Strengthens gluteal muscles and supports hip extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet hip-width apart.
2. Press through your heels and lift your hips until your body forms a straight line.
3. Squeeze your glutes at the top and avoid overextending your lower back.
4. Lower your hips back down with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Drive through your heels and lift by squeezing the glutes while keeping ribs down

Health benefit: Improves lateral coordination and light aerobic movement
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Step to the right with your right foot and bring your left foot to touch next to it.
3. Open your arms out wide as you step and keep a slight bend in your knees.
4. Repeat the motion to the left and continue alternating steps.
Safety cue: Step with control and maintain an upright posture with core engaged

Health benefit: Relieves neck tension and increases upper neck mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and rotate your head about 45 degrees toward one side.
2. Tilt your chin downward toward your chest slowly.
3. Place your hand on the back of your head and gently guide the movement for a deeper stretch.
4. Hold briefly then return to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders relaxed and tuck the chin slightly to lengthen the side of the neck

Health benefit: Enhances balance and proprioception during gait
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and focus your gaze forward with your head up.
2. Step forward placing your heel on the ground first and then roll onto your toe.
3. Keep a straight line by placing each foot directly in front of the other.
4. Continue walking in this heel-to-toe pattern for the desired distance.
Safety cue: Keep head up, shoulders relaxed, and take controlled heel-to-toe steps

Health benefit: Improves scapular stability and shoulder posture control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with arms relaxed at your sides.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and down without shrugging.
3. Hold the contraction for the desired time then relax.
Safety cue: Squeeze the shoulder blades together without shrugging and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Enhances cardiovascular fitness and hip flexor activation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed.
2. Lift your right knee toward hip level slowly while keeping your torso upright.
3. Lower the leg and repeat with the left knee in a controlled alternating rhythm.
Safety cue: Brace your core and lift knees tall without arching or crunching the lower back

Health benefit: Improves thoracic spine mobility and upper back rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Get on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Place your right hand behind your head and keep the left hand planted for support.
3. Rotate your upper back and lift your right elbow toward the ceiling, opening the chest.
4. Return the elbow down and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips square and rotate through the thoracic spine with slow controlled movement

Health benefit: Promotes gentle spinal extension and chest opening
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your stomach with forearms on the floor and elbows under your shoulders.
2. Press into your forearms and lift your chest while keeping hips and pelvis grounded.
3. Hold the lifted position with a long spine and relaxed neck.
Safety cue: Stack elbows under shoulders, relax the shoulders and breathe into the chest

Health benefit: Develops single leg balance and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand sideways near a wall and place one hand lightly on the wall for support.
2. Shift weight onto the standing foot and place the opposite foot on the inner calf or thigh, avoiding the knee.
3. Press the foot into the standing leg and lengthen through the spine.
4. Keep the other hand on the wall or lift it and hold your balance.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and lower back endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Simultaneously lift your arms, chest, and legs off the floor using your back and glutes.
3. Hold the elevated position with a neutral neck and then lower back down.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves lateral movement coordination and hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and knees slightly bent.
2. Step your right foot diagonally behind the left while swinging your arms across your body.
3. Shift weight onto the right foot and bring the left foot back to center.
4. Repeat the movement to the opposite side in a controlled, gliding pattern.
Safety cue: Maintain a slight knee bend, hinge at the hips and land softly with controlled steps

Health benefit: Enhances cervical alignment and reduces forward head posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with feet flat and hands resting on your thighs.
2. Tuck your chin straight back to create a double chin without tilting the head up or down.
3. Hold the retracted position briefly and then relax to neutral.
Safety cue: Retract the chin straight back, keep eyes level and avoid tilting the head

Health benefit: Increases shoulder mobility and latissimus flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands on the wall at shoulder height or higher.
2. Walk your feet back and lower your hips while keeping your arms straight until you feel a stretch along the sides of your torso.
3. Hold the stretch with a long spine and then walk your feet forward to release.
Safety cue: Keep ribs down, reach through the arm and avoid shrugging the shoulder toward the ear

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and functional hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and take a controlled small step forward with your right foot.
2. Bend both knees slightly into a shallow lunge, keeping the front knee aligned over the ankle.
3. Push through the front foot to bring the back foot forward and stand tall.
4. Continue alternating legs as you move forward with shallow lunges.
Safety cue: Keep the torso upright, front knee tracking over the ankle and control each step forward

Health benefit: Engages posterior chain and improves core and shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and hands placed slightly behind your hips with fingers pointing toward your feet.
2. Press through your hands and heels to lift your hips until your body forms a straight line from shoulders to heels.
3. Squeeze your glutes and lengthen through the spine while keeping shoulders down.
4. Lower your hips back to the floor with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances coordination and low impact aerobic conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet together and arms at your sides.
2. Step your right foot out diagonally while raising both arms overhead.
3. Return feet together while lowering arms to your sides.
4. Repeat to the left and continue alternating at a controlled pace.
Safety cue: Keep core braced and spine neutral while stepping with soft knees

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and warms stabilizing muscles
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width and extend arms straight out to the sides at shoulder height.
2. Rotate both arms backward in small controlled circles using the shoulder joint.
3. Gradually increase the circle size while keeping a steady rhythm and neutral spine.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and rotate arms with controlled motion

Health benefit: Increases neck flexibility and relieves muscular tension
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
2. Tilt your head to the right and rotate slightly to look up and over your right shoulder.
3. Place your right hand on the left side of your head and gently pull to increase the stretch.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders relaxed and gently guide your head without forcing the stretch

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and posterior chain strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand beside a stable chair and place one hand lightly on the back for support.
2. Shift weight to the standing leg and hinge at the hips while lifting the other leg straight back.
3. Lower your torso until you feel a stretch in the standing hamstring while keeping a flat back.
4. Drive the hips forward to return to standing and repeat on the other leg.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens chest and shoulder muscles with reduced load
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall with feet hip-width and place hands wider than shoulder-width on the wall.
2. Bend elbows and lower your chest toward the wall while keeping your body in a straight line.
3. Push through your palms to straighten the arms and return to the starting position.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels and lower with controlled elbow bend

Health benefit: Improves core activation and coordination between upper and lower body
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and raise both arms overhead.
2. Lift your right knee toward your chest while pulling your arms down toward your sides.
3. Lower the leg and arms to start and repeat on the opposite side with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Brace your core and exhale as you lift the knee while controlling the arm pull

Health benefit: Promotes spinal mobility and gentle trunk rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Place your right hand on the left knee and your left hand behind you for support.
3. Rotate your torso to the left using your hands to guide the twist and keep the spine long.
Safety cue: Sit tall and rotate from your thoracic spine while keeping both hips grounded

Health benefit: Gently lengthens the spine and encourages relaxation
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on the floor with big toes together and knees hip-width or wider.
2. Sit back toward your heels and reach both arms forward on the mat while lowering your chest.
3. Rest your forehead on the ground and relax the shoulders away from the ears.
Safety cue: Sit hips back toward heels and breathe steadily while reaching through your fingertips

Health benefit: Builds core stability and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Tuck your toes and lift your knees a few inches off the floor to form a straight line from head to heels.
3. Keep your core braced and avoid sagging or piking of the hips.
4. Maintain alignment for the desired duration with steady control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Targets upper back muscles to improve posture and scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs extended and arms straight out to the sides at shoulder level.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades and lift both arms a few inches off the floor into a T shape.
3. Lower the arms with control and repeat without arching the lower back.
Safety cue: Keep your neck neutral and lift the arms with a controlled scapular squeeze

Health benefit: Enhances lateral coordination and light cardiovascular conditioning
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and arms raised diagonally in a V.
2. Step your right foot toward the center while keeping arms lifted.
3. Return your right foot to the wide position and lower arms slightly.
4. Repeat the movement to the left side in a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Keep chest lifted and step deliberately with arms wide for balance

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and thoracic rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand sideways to a wall and place one hand on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Rotate your torso and sweep the opposite arm up and overhead in a controlled arc.
3. Reverse the motion to return to start and repeat for the other side.
Safety cue: Stand tall with ribs down and sweep arms slowly to maintain shoulder control

Health benefit: Improves quadriceps flexibility and knee joint range of motion
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and bend your right knee, reaching back to grab your right ankle.
2. Pull your heel toward your glute while keeping knees close and hips level.
3. Keep your chest upright and hold the stretch, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips squared and chest up while gently pulling heel toward the glute

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and lift your right knee toward your chest, holding behind the shin with both hands.
2. Engage your core and balance on your left foot while keeping your gaze forward.
3. Release and repeat the hold on the opposite leg.
Safety cue: Keep standing knee soft and core engaged while hugging the knee toward the chest

Health benefit: Builds upper body pushing strength with manageable intensity
Steps to perform:
1. Place hands shoulder-width on a stable counter and step your feet back into a straight line.
2. Brace your core and keep your body in a straight plank from head to heels.
3. Lower your chest toward the counter by bending both elbows.
4. Push through your hands to straighten your arms and return to the start.
Safety cue: Maintain a straight line from head to heels and lower with control

Health benefit: Improves lower body strength and squat movement confidence
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in front of a sturdy chair with feet hip-width and toes slightly turned out.
2. Push your hips back and bend your knees to lower until your glutes lightly touch the chair.
3. Keep your chest lifted and weight over your heels.
4. Drive through your heels to stand back up to full extension.
Safety cue: Sit back into the chair with weight in the heels and chest lifted

Health benefit: Enhances lateral agility and low impact cardiovascular fitness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and shift your weight onto your left foot.
2. Step your right foot diagonally behind your left foot and tap lightly.
3. Push off the right foot to step your left foot out to the left and shift weight.
4. Swing your arms across your body and repeat to the other side in a controlled rhythm.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and control each lateral step

Health benefit: Improves static balance and proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot directly in front of the other so the heel of the front foot touches the toes of the back foot.
2. Keep hips level, shoulders relaxed, and gaze forward.
3. Hold the position while maintaining steady breathing and balance.
Safety cue: Stack heel to toe with hips level and gaze forward for balance

Health benefit: Strengthens scapular stabilizers and supports better upper back posture
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with arms relaxed at your sides and shoulders down.
2. Squeeze your shoulder blades together and draw them slightly down toward your spine.
3. Hold the contraction briefly, then release to the starting position.
Safety cue: Pull shoulder blades together gently without shrugging the shoulders

Health benefit: Strengthens gluteal muscles and supports hip stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat hip-width.
2. Press through heels and lift hips until body forms a straight line.
3. Squeeze glutes at the top.
4. Lower hips back down with control.
Safety cue: Squeeze glutes and maintain a neutral spine as you lift

Health benefit: Improves lateral coordination and light cardiovascular activity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and knees slightly bent.
2. Step to the side with one foot and touch the other foot next to it.
3. Repeat alternating sides at a steady pace.
Safety cue: Step deliberately with soft knees and an upright chest

Health benefit: Increases shoulder mobility and relieves muscular tension
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit tall with arms relaxed at sides.
2. Lift shoulders toward ears, roll them back and down in a smooth circle.
3. Repeat the roll in the opposite direction.
Safety cue: Roll shoulders slowly while keeping your neck relaxed

Health benefit: Enhances hamstring flexibility and improves seated posture
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on a chair with one leg extended and heel on the floor.
2. Keep the back straight and hinge at the hips toward the extended leg.
3. Reach toward the toes until a gentle stretch is felt.
4. Hold briefly and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep a long spine and hinge from the hips to reach your hamstrings

Health benefit: Improves single leg balance and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand next to a sturdy surface and place one hand on it for support.
2. Lift one foot off the floor and balance on the other leg.
3. Keep hips level and hold, then lower the lifted foot back down.
Safety cue: Stand tall with hips level and use support lightly

Health benefit: Builds core endurance and improves postural control
Steps to perform:
1. Start on knees and forearms with elbows under shoulders.
2. Engage core and lift hips so body forms a straight line from head to knees.
3. Keep neck neutral and hold the position.
4. Lower hips back to the floor to rest.
Safety cue: Brace your core and keep hips aligned with shoulders

Health benefit: Strengthens quadriceps and boosts lower body endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with back against a wall and feet hip-width apart a short distance away.
2. Slide down the wall until knees are bent about 90 degrees.
3. Keep weight in heels and hold the position.
Safety cue: Keep weight in your heels and knees tracking over ankles

Health benefit: Promotes gentle cardiovascular activity and circulation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and lift one knee toward hip level while keeping posture upright.
2. Lower that foot and lift the opposite knee in a steady rhythm.
3. Swing arms naturally and continue marching.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright posture and lift knees with control

Health benefit: Enhances trunk rotation mobility and supports functional movement
Steps to perform:
1. Sit upright with feet flat and hands resting on thighs.
2. Rotate torso to one side using your core, keeping hips facing forward.
3. Look over the shoulder while maintaining an upright spine.
4. Return to center and repeat on the opposite side.
Safety cue: Twist from the torso with a tall spine and neutral neck

Health benefit: Opens chest and increases shoulder extension range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit tall and interlace fingers behind your back.
2. Straighten arms and gently lift the clasped hands away from your back.
3. Open the chest by drawing shoulder blades together.
4. Hold the position briefly and release.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades together and keep your neck long

Health benefit: Improves balance and proprioception
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and arms extended to the sides.
2. Place one foot directly in front of the other so the heel touches the toe.
3. Walk forward slowly along an imaginary straight line using heel-to-toe steps.
4. Keep eyes forward and use your arms to maintain balance.
Safety cue: Keep eyes forward and step heel to toe with controlled balance

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves spinal extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with legs straight and hands resting alongside your hips.
2. Press the tops of your feet and pelvis into the floor and squeeze your glutes.
3. Lift your chest and upper ribs off the floor while keeping your arms by your sides.
4. Hold briefly while squeezing the shoulder blades together then lower slowly.
Safety cue: Squeeze shoulder blades and lift chest while keeping a neutral neck

Health benefit: Enhances lower body strength and functional stair climbing ability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a sturdy box or step with feet hip-width apart.
2. Step onto the box with one foot and press through the heel to lift your body.
3. Bring the trailing foot up to stand tall on the box.
4. Step down leading with the same foot and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Press through the whole foot and keep hips level as you step up

Health benefit: Increases spinal mobility and promotes coordination between flexion and extension
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Inhale and drop your belly while lifting your chest and tailbone upward (Cow).
3. Exhale and round your spine while tucking your chin and tailbone (Cat).
4. Move slowly between positions with controlled breathing.
Safety cue: Move slowly through flexion and extension while keeping core engaged

Health benefit: Improves ankle dorsiflexion and calf muscle flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand facing a wall and place both hands on the wall at shoulder height.
2. Step one foot back keeping that leg straight and the back heel on the floor.
3. Bend the front knee and lean toward the wall until you feel a stretch in the back calf.
4. Hold, then switch legs and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep back leg straight with heel down and maintain a tall posture

Health benefit: Develops single leg balance and neuromuscular control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and engage your core.
2. Shift your weight onto one leg and lift the other foot to rest against the inner calf or ankle.
3. Find a focal point and hold your balance with a straight spine.
4. Lower the lifted foot and switch legs.
Safety cue: Keep standing knee slightly bent and hinge at the hips to stay balanced

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and supports pelvic stability
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with your legs straight and your head supported by your hand.
2. Lift the top leg upward keeping hips stacked and toes pointing forward.
3. Lower the leg slowly with control and repeat, then switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and lift with control avoiding torso rotation

Health benefit: Boosts hamstring activation and provides low impact cardiovascular activity
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with knees slightly bent and arms relaxed.
2. March in place while lifting heels toward your glutes one foot at a time.
3. Land softly and maintain a steady rhythm with a slight arm swing.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees tracking under hips and maintain an upright torso

Health benefit: Improves wrist mobility and reduces forearm stiffness
Steps to perform:
1. Extend one arm in front with fingers relaxed and elbow slightly bent.
2. Rotate your wrist slowly in a full clockwise circle several times.
3. Reverse direction and rotate your wrist counterclockwise the same number of times.
Safety cue: Move wrists slowly through the full range while keeping forearms relaxed

Health benefit: Enhances cervical range of motion and relieves neck tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed and gaze forward.
2. Slowly turn your head to the right until you feel a gentle stretch.
3. Turn your head slowly to the left until you feel a gentle stretch and repeat.
Safety cue: Rotate head slowly within comfort keeping shoulders down and spine neutral

Health benefit: Improves inner thigh and groin flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall with the soles of your feet together and knees dropped outward.
2. Hold your feet with both hands and pull your heels toward your groin.
3. Press your knees gently toward the floor with your elbows.
4. Lean forward from the hips to deepen the stretch.
Safety cue: Sit tall, hinge from the hips and keep your spine long

Health benefit: Enhances dynamic core stability and balance
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on your sit bones with knees bent and feet flat, hands by your shins.
2. Rock back onto your shoulder blades, keeping your chest lifted.
3. Rock forward onto your sit bones and balance tall.
4. Repeat the rocking motion with controlled movements.
Safety cue: Brace your core and move slowly to control each rocking motion

Health benefit: Strengthens lower abdominal engagement and pelvic control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat, arms by your sides.
2. Lift your head and shoulders slightly and engage your core.
3. Extend one leg and tap the heel to the floor beside your hip.
4. Return the leg and repeat on the other side with steady control.
Safety cue: Press your lower back into the floor and tap the heels with controlled breaths

Health benefit: Improves hip extension strength and trunk stability
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with a neutral spine.
2. Extend one leg straight back until it is level with your hip.
3. Keep hips square and lower the leg back to the starting position.
4. Repeat with the opposite leg while maintaining balance.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and extend the leg with slow, controlled motion

Health benefit: Boosts upper body muscular endurance and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hands up in a guard position.
2. Step slightly forward with one foot and snap a straight jab with the lead hand.
3. Retract the hand back to guard and alternate jabs quickly.
4. Keep weight light on your feet and maintain a steady rhythm.
Safety cue: Tuck your chin, rotate through the torso and snap each jab with a controlled exhale

Health benefit: Increases hip joint mobility and movement control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and hands on your hips.
2. Shift your hips forward and then rotate them in a full circle.
3. Reverse the circle direction after several rotations.
4. Keep your torso stable and move only your hips.
Safety cue: Stand tall, move the hip slowly and keep the pelvis level throughout the circle

Health benefit: Improves chest flexibility and shoulder joint range
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in a doorway and place your forearm low on one side of the frame.
2. Step forward slightly and rotate your torso away from the frame.
3. Keep your shoulder down and feel the stretch across the lower chest.
4. Hold and switch sides to repeat the stretch on the other arm.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and ankle stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall on one leg and place the toes of the other foot against the inside calf or ankle with toes touching the floor.
2. Press the lifted foot gently into the standing leg and find your balance.
3. Bring your hands to your heart or raise them overhead.
4. Hold the position with steady breath and then switch sides.
Safety cue: Stand tall, press the foot into the standing leg and keep hips squared

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width and toes turned out.
2. Bend at the hips and knees to lower into a squat until thighs are parallel to the floor.
3. Press your knees outward and keep your chest lifted.
4. Push through your heels to stand back up.
Safety cue: Push knees out over the toes, keep your chest lifted and lower with control

Health benefit: Activates anterior lower leg muscles and improves foot control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width and hands relaxed by your sides.
2. Extend one heel forward and dig it into the floor with toes up.
3. Return the foot to neutral and repeat on the other side in a rhythmic pattern.
Safety cue: Anchor your heels into the floor and brace the core while keeping a neutral spine

Health benefit: Improves pelvic mobility and lower back control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
2. Tilt your pelvis to flatten your lower back against the floor.
3. Hold the tilt for a few seconds while breathing evenly.
4. Release to a neutral spine and repeat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Increases wrist flexibility and reduces forearm tightness
Steps to perform:
1. Extend one arm forward with the palm facing up.
2. Use the opposite hand to gently pull the fingers and wrist down toward you.
3. Hold the stretch for 20–30 seconds and switch sides.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and posterior chain strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto one leg.
2. Hinge at the hips while lifting the free leg straight back and keeping a flat spine.
3. Lower your torso until you feel tension in the standing leg without rounding your back.
4. Drive the hips forward to return to standing and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips with a neutral spine and drive weight through the standing heel

Health benefit: Builds triceps endurance and upper body pressing ability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and hands placed behind your hips.
2. Lift your hips slightly and bend your elbows to lower your body a few inches.
3. Push through your palms to straighten your arms and raise your hips.
4. Repeat the lowering and lifting movement with control.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and elbows tucked close to your sides as you lower with control

Health benefit: Raises heart rate while improving lateral coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet together and hands resting low at your sides.
2. Step one foot out to the side while keeping your arms low and controlled.
3. Step the other foot out to meet it and switch which foot leads.
4. Continue alternating steps at a steady pace.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and maintain an upright chest with core engaged

Health benefit: Improves ankle mobility and proprioceptive awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or lie down and lift one foot off the ground.
2. Rotate your ankle in slow circles in one direction.
3. Reverse the direction after several rotations and switch feet.
Safety cue: Move slowly through the full range with the shin stable and toes relaxed

Health benefit: Promotes gentle spinal elongation and shoulder opening
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel and sit back on your heels with knees about hip-width apart.
2. Reach both arms back alongside your torso and rest your palms on the floor.
3. Sink your hips toward your heels and relax your forehead to the mat.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift your weight onto one leg.
2. Bend the opposite knee and bring that foot toward your inner calf or ankle.
3. Hold your balance with a soft standing knee and switch sides.
Safety cue: Keep a soft knee, engage the standing glute, and fix your gaze to steady balance

Health benefit: Strengthens hip abductors and supports pelvic alignment
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with hips and knees bent and feet stacked.
2. Keep your heels together and lift the top knee upward by opening the hip.
3. Pause at the top without rotating your pelvis.
4. Lower the knee with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and hinge at the outer hip while maintaining a stable pelvis

Health benefit: Improves knee mobility and rhythmic movement control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with one knee bent and foot flat on the floor.
2. Slightly lift the bent foot by contracting the thigh to straighten the knee a small amount.
3. Lower the foot back down while keeping the heel in contact with the floor.
4. Repeat the lift-and-lower motion and then switch legs.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves thoracic spine mobility and rotational range
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees bent and hips stacked.
2. Place your top hand behind your head and extend the bottom arm straight on the floor.
3. Rotate your upper torso to lift the top arm toward the ceiling and follow with your eyes.
4. Return the top arm to the floor in front of you and repeat in a controlled manner.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and rotate through the upper back

Health benefit: Enhances hip external rotation and glute flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit tall on the floor with legs extended.
2. Cross your right ankle over your left knee and flex the right foot.
3. Hinge forward from the hips until you feel a stretch in the right buttock.
Safety cue: Sit tall and hinge forward from the hips to avoid rounding the lower back

Health benefit: Improves ankle mobility and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart.
2. Shift your weight onto your heels, then rock forward onto your toes.
3. Continue rocking heel-to-toe in a controlled, rhythmic motion.
Safety cue: Shift slowly from heel to toe with controlled movement and upright posture

Health benefit: Improves rotational core stability and oblique activation
Steps to perform:
1. Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet flat.
2. Lean back slightly to create a stable diagonal and clasp your hands together.
3. Rotate your torso to the right, tapping the floor beside your hip.
4. Rotate to the left and repeat with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Brace the core and rotate from the ribs while keeping the feet grounded

Health benefit: Enhances hamstring flexibility and dynamic hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and extend your arms forward at shoulder height.
2. Keeping the lead leg straight, kick it up to hip height while reaching the opposite hand toward the toes.
3. Step forward and repeat on the other leg in a controlled marching pattern.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds hip mobility and inner thigh strength
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes turned out.
2. Bend your knees and lower hips into a squat while pushing knees outward.
3. Keep your chest upright and weight evenly distributed.
4. Press through the heels to stand back up with control.
Safety cue: Push knees out over toes and keep weight in the heels with a straight spine

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and chest flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with arms extended forward at shoulder height and palms touching.
2. Open your arms wide out to the sides in a controlled motion.
3. Cross one arm over the other and then switch so the opposite arm crosses on the next repetition.
Safety cue: Move the arms with control and keep shoulders down away from the ears

Health benefit: Enhances multi joint mobility and movement integration
Steps to perform:
1. Step into a forward lunge with the right foot forward and hands on the ground inside the front foot.
2. Rotate your torso to the right and reach your right arm up toward the ceiling while keeping the left hand planted.
3. Return the right hand to the ground and bring both hands inside the front foot.
4. Repeat on the other side with controlled movement.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and move slowly through each reach and rotation

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and standing balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wide and turn the front foot 90 degrees and the back foot slightly in.
2. Bend the front knee until it is stacked over the ankle and extend both arms out to the sides at shoulder height.
3. Keep your torso upright and gaze over the front hand.
4. Press through the front heel to maintain a steady stance.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves shoulder blade mobility and thoracic spine extension
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended overhead and legs straight.
2. Lift your chest slightly and sweep your right arm forward then down by your side while the left arm reaches back.
3. Alternate the arm motions smoothly to simulate a swimming stroke.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hinge slightly at the knees.
2. Push off one foot to step laterally and land softly on the other foot.
3. Shift weight and repeat the step back to the starting side.
4. Maintain a light spring and steady rhythm throughout.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and chest lifted

Health benefit: Enhances hip mobility and rotational control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with both knees bent at 90 degrees on the floor.
2. Rotate to place one leg forward and the other behind, keeping knees at 90.
3. Use your hands to assist the front knee to rotate and the back knee to open.
4. Switch legs smoothly to the opposite 90/90 position.
Safety cue: Control the pelvic rotation and keep the torso upright

Health benefit: Improves upper back mobility and shoulder girdle flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and extend both arms forward at shoulder height.
2. Cross one arm over the other and bend elbows to wrap forearms, palms touching if possible.
3. Lift elbows and draw shoulder blades down the back.
4. Hold the wrapped position and breathe evenly.
Safety cue: Pull shoulders down away from ears and breathe evenly

Health benefit: Enhances balance and proprioceptive control during gait
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with one foot directly in front of the other so toes and heel align.
2. Keep eyes forward and take small steps backward, placing toes to heel each step.
3. Maintain upright posture and controlled balance on each step.
Safety cue: Take slow controlled backward steps and keep the torso upright

Health benefit: Builds core stability and shoulder endurance
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips.
2. Lift knees an inch off the ground and keep hips level.
3. Brace the core and hold the position with steady breathing.
Safety cue: Maintain a neutral spine and brace the core with shoulders over wrists

Health benefit: Promotes hip flexor activation and dynamic leg coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and drive one knee quickly toward your chest.
2. Lower that foot back to the ground with control.
3. Alternate knees in a steady, rhythmic manner.
Safety cue: Keep chest up and drive the knee with controlled hip flexion

Health benefit: Increases thoracic rotation and scapular mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with knees slightly bent and top arm extended on the floor.
2. Rotate your torso and reach the top arm up and across toward the far side.
3. Return the arm to the starting position with controlled motion.
Safety cue: Rotate from the thoracic spine and keep the hips stacked

Health benefit: Improves hip opening and lower body stability in single leg stance
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on one knee with the opposite leg extended to the side.
2. Keep hips square and slide your torso over the bent leg while reaching overhead.
3. Lower your hand toward the ankle and lengthen the side body.
4. Return upright and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Lengthen the spine and hinge from the hips with the supporting knee soft

Health benefit: Develops posterior chain strength and single leg balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with a support nearby and hold it lightly with one hand.
2. Hinge at the hips on the standing leg and extend the other leg back for balance.
3. Lower your torso until it is near parallel, keeping the back straight.
4. Return to standing by driving the hip of the support leg forward.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Strengthens inner thigh muscles and improves medial hip control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your side with legs extended and top leg resting on the floor in front.
2. Lift the bottom leg upward toward the top leg using the inner thigh.
3. Lower the bottom leg with control and repeat.
Safety cue: Keep hips stacked and perform slow controlled lifts without twisting the torso

Health benefit: Enhances rotational power and upper body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand in an athletic stance with feet shoulder-width and hands up.
2. Rotate your lead foot and hips to deliver a compact hook from the front hand.
3. Rotate your rear foot and hips to deliver a compact hook from the back hand.
4. Alternate hooks with controlled returns to guard and maintain rhythm.
Safety cue: Rotate from the hips and keep elbows tucked to protect the shoulder

Health benefit: Improves wrist mobility and dynamic control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand or sit tall and extend one arm forward with a relaxed hand.
2. Initiate a smooth wave by flexing and extending the wrist in a rippling motion.
3. Repeat the wave pulses and switch arms after a set of repetitions.
Safety cue: Move slowly through the full range and keep the forearm aligned with the wrist

Health benefit: Increases hamstring and lower back flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width and hinge at the hips to fold forward with a soft bend in the knees.
2. Let your head and arms hang heavy toward the floor and relax the neck.
3. Hold the folded position and gently sway or straighten the knees to release tension.
Safety cue: Hinge at the hips with a soft knee bend and maintain a long spine

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and core stability
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto one foot while keeping a soft knee.
2. Extend the opposite arm and opposite leg out to form a straight line.
3. Open the chest and reach the other arm diagonally upward to complete the star shape.
4. Hold the position and keep the supporting core engaged for balance.
Safety cue: Keep hips level and reach through the lifted leg while maintaining a tall spine

Health benefit: Strengthens gluteal muscles and improves hip extension control
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and brace your core while placing hands on hips or a stable surface.
2. Squeeze the glute of one leg and lift that leg straight back without arching the lower back.
3. Lower the leg with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Squeeze the glute to drive hip extension while keeping the pelvis level and spine neutral

Health benefit: Improves lateral core activation and hip rotational mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet hip-width and hold arms forward as if holding poles.
2. Shift weight side to side while swinging the arms and torso in a controlled lateral arc.
3. Keep a slight knee bend and alternate sides with fluid, skiing-like motion.
Safety cue: Drive the movement from the hips, keep chest up and maintain soft knees

Health benefit: Enhances thoracic rotation and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Lie face down with arms extended out to the sides and forehead on the floor.
2. Bend one knee and lift the foot toward the opposite hand while keeping the pelvis grounded.
3. Rotate the knee across the body to bring the foot toward the floor near the opposite hand.
4. Return the leg to center and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Anchor the pelvis and rotate the leg with slow controlled motion

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and upper back flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand tall and reach one arm overhead then bend the elbow to drop the hand between the shoulder blades.
2. Reach the other arm behind the back and climb the fingers up to meet the top hand.
3. Clasp the hands or hold a strap and lift the chest to deepen the shoulder stretch.
Safety cue: Lift the chest and draw the shoulder blades together to maintain alignment

Health benefit: Improves multidirectional hip mobility and dynamic balance
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and imagine a clock around you with 12 directions and keep weight centered.
2. Step shallowly forward into a light lunge toward a chosen clock direction with soft knee bend.
3. Push back to the starting position and reset your balance.
4. Repeat stepping to different clock directions while keeping lunges shallow.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds core stability while increasing light cardiovascular engagement
Steps to perform:
1. Start in a forearm plank with body in a straight line and feet together.
2. Step one foot out to the side and then bring it back to center.
3. Alternate stepping the other foot out and maintain a steady plank throughout.
Safety cue: Maintain a braced core and level hips while stepping the feet with controlled tempo

Health benefit: Enhances coordination and cardiovascular fitness
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall with feet hip-width apart and hold hands as if gripping a rope.
2. Rotate wrists in small circles and swing arms forward and backward to simulate rope rotation.
3. Jump lightly on the balls of your feet as each imaginary rope passes under and land softly.
Safety cue: Land softly with knees slightly bent and core engaged

Health benefit: Improves neck mobility and posture awareness
Steps to perform:
1. Sit or stand upright with shoulders relaxed and eyes forward.
2. Push the chin forward to protract the neck while keeping the gaze level.
3. Pull the chin back and tuck to retract the neck, returning to neutral.
Safety cue: Keep chin level and move the head slowly without shrugging the shoulders

Health benefit: Increases thoracic spine mobility and shoulder flexibility
Steps to perform:
1. Start on hands and knees with hips above knees and shoulders above wrists.
2. Walk hands forward and lower the chest toward the mat while keeping hips high.
3. Rest the forehead or chin on the floor and lengthen the spine.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and hip external rotation
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and shift weight onto the left foot.
2. Cross the right thigh over the left and hook the right foot behind the left calf or use a strap to assist.
3. Bend the standing knee and sink the hips slightly while keeping the spine long.
4. Hold a support or bring hands to balance and keep the position steady.
Safety cue: Keep hips level, squeeze knees together, and maintain an upright spine

Health benefit: Strengthens posterior chain and improves shoulder stability
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended and hands placed behind hips with fingers pointing toward feet.
2. Press into hands and heels to lift hips until the body forms a straight line from head to heels.
3. Squeeze the glutes, keep the neck neutral, and lower the hips back down with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves lateral agility and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand tall and take a lateral step to the right leading with the right foot.
2. Cross the left foot behind the right, then step the right foot to the right again.
3. Continue the crossing pattern slowly for a set distance, then repeat to the left.
Safety cue: Maintain an upright torso, rotate hips and shoulders together, and step with control

Health benefit: Improves shoulder and chest mobility and scapular control
Steps to perform:
1. Lie on your back with arms extended out to the sides and legs straight.
2. Lift one leg and cross it slowly over the midline toward the opposite side while keeping shoulders flat.
3. Hold briefly and trace the leg back to center with control.
4. Repeat on the opposite side for equal reps.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders anchored to the floor and move arms with slow controlled range of motion

Health benefit: Increases hamstring flexibility and hip hinge mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Kneel on one knee with the opposite leg extended forward and the heel on the ground.
2. Square the hips and hinge at the front hip to fold over the extended leg while keeping the spine long.
3. Reach toward the front foot, hold the stretch, and return upright with control.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Builds lower body strength and enhances standing balance
Steps to perform:
1. Step one foot forward into a lunge with the front knee bent and the back foot turned slightly out.
2. Square the hips to face forward and lift the torso upright.
3. Reach both arms overhead and draw the shoulder blades down.
4. Press into both feet and sink deeper into the front knee while keeping weight balanced.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Develops hip strength and improves squat and hinge mechanics
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wider than hip-width and toes angled slightly outward.
2. Hinge at the hips and push the knees outward while lowering the torso with a flat back.
3. Drive the hips forward and squeeze the glutes to return to standing.
Safety cue: Maintain controlled movement and proper alignment throughout

Health benefit: Improves shoulder mobility and upper body coordination
Steps to perform:
1. Stand feet hip-width apart with knees soft and core engaged.
2. Raise one fist toward the ceiling with elbow slightly bent.
3. Snap the fist upward and slightly forward while rotating the shoulder.
4. Lower with control and repeat on the other side.
Safety cue: Keep shoulders down and core braced as you punch upward

Health benefit: Enhances ankle mobility and proprioceptive control
Steps to perform:
1. Sit with legs extended or supported and feet relaxed.
2. Turn the sole of one foot inward to feel inversion.
3. Turn the sole of the same foot outward to feel eversion.
Safety cue: Move the ankle slowly with control and keep the foot aligned under the shin

Health benefit: Improves lateral torso flexibility and hip mobility
Steps to perform:
1. Stand with feet wide and arms extended at shoulder height.
2. Turn front foot forward and back foot slightly in.
3. Reach the front hand toward the front ankle and lift the opposite arm up.
4. Keep length through the torso and hold the position.
Safety cue: Stack the hips and maintain a long spine while reaching through the top arm

Health benefit: Enhances single leg balance and posterior chain stability
Steps to perform:
